title: Recruiter
description:
Wisdom Teeth Guys is looking for a Recruiter to recruit for multiple departments!

\\*\\*\\*Note priority is given to candidates the complete the Indeed one way video interview. You should get a link in your email.

To be successful in this role, you should be well-organized, have great time management skills and be able to act without guidance.

This is a chance to become part of a company that is changing the way oral surgery services are marketed and delivered. The oral surgery world is changing rapidly and Wisdom Teeth Guys is at the forefront of that change! Join a team with several thousand 5 star reviews!

**Preferred**:

* Substantial experience in recruitment (healthcare recruiting desirable but not required).
* Dental experience helpful but not required.

This is a rare opportunity for a work from home position for an experienced professional.

You will recruit across various Wisdom Teeth Guys departments including call center/scheduling, insurance, accounting and clinical.

You must be:

* Meticulous - you have a fine eye for the details.
* Resourceful - you always find a way to make it work.
* Positive - Pleasant to be around and work with.
* Hyper-organized - Able to handle a large variety of projects and tasks and make sure nothing falls between the cracks.
* Utterly Reliable
* Completely Trustworthy
* Well Spoken - Can communicate professionally over the phone and in writing.
* Independent
* Team Player
* Have Common Sense & Business Sense
* Comfortable with Technology
* Amazing Problem Solver

Responsibilities include:

* Recruiting staff for multiple departments in the company.

Applicants should live in in one of these states: AZ, FL, NV, TN, TX, UT, WA, WY. You do not need to live in any of our existing markets for this position. This is a fully remote position.

Position is full time 40 plus hours per week. You must have a work environment conducive to working at home and the impeccable discipline to do so!

Please apply through Indeed and please complete the one way video interview!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Experience level:

* 3 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Do you have a home work set up conducive to privately doing video interviews while recruiting?
* Do you reside in one of the following states? : AZ, FL, NV, TN, TX, UT, WA, WY

Experience:

* Recruiting: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Talent Acquisition Manager
description:
**About PeopleOps Jobs**

We started PeopleOps Jobs (https://peopleopsjobs.io) to help companies that care about HR find the right people in the HR and People Operations world.

--

**Job Description**

The position is at a tech company. As a key component of our dynamic team, the Talent Acquisition Manager drives our development and success by identifying, recruiting, and keeping top-tier talent. You will oversee the whole recruiting process, from devising creative sourcing tactics to conducting interviews and negotiating offers.

**Responsibilities**

* Create and implement innovative sourcing methods to recruit top talent using a variety of channels, including job boards, social media, networking events, and industry alliances.
* Utilize a strong technical sourcing background to successfully discover, engage, and hire engineers and product experts with the necessary skills and knowledge to advance our technology and product development efforts.
* Conduct rigorous applicant evaluations, including resume screening and virtual interviews, to determine individuals' credentials, abilities, and potential contributions to the culture.
* Develop good connections with hiring managers to better understand their workforce requirements, offer advice on recruiting best practices, and guarantee a seamless recruitment process.
* Collaborate with the Leadership Team to develop job descriptions, remuneration packages, and hiring strategies that are consistent with the company's goals and growth targets.
* Manage the candidate experience from application to onboarding, delivering a good and smooth trip for all applicants.
* To consistently enhance our talent acquisition operations, we must stay up to date on industry trends, best practices, and unique recruitment tactics.
* Use data to track recruitment statistics, evaluate hiring patterns, and give insights to help you make better decisions and enhance your recruiting efforts.

**Qualifications**

* An experienced and well-rounded TA Manager with a track record of success, notably in engineering and product positions in start-ups. You've hired for positions ranging from entry-level to VP and beyond, focusing on bringing in the appropriate people at the right time.
* When it comes to candidate sourcing, be scrappy and look outside the box. We all know that LinkedIn is a terrific resource, but what else do you use?
* You thrive in an autonomous setting and hold strong opinions about what you do. You have fresh insights and are not afraid to try new things or challenge recruiting supervisors.
* Analytical, assessing the health of your pipelines using funnel data rather than sentiments.
* Curious and thoughtful, understand the hiring manager's/team's needs during the intake process, and recalibrate throughout to guarantee we bring on top performers.
* Hungry and with a clear goal, we ensure that we track and measure each level of the funnel, ensuring that prospects get through the process on time.

**Pay:** $85k to $115k annually

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $85,000.00 - $115,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Work Location: Remote

title: Recruiting Coordinator
description:
**Company Overview:**  


  

The next generation of ADT Commercial is here. At Everon, we truly believe that our people are the difference – for our organization, the customers we serve and the communities we protect. When you’re a part of Everon, you’ll have the opportunity to be a part of that difference every day. With more than 100 locations, a deep national presence, and comprehensive portfolio of solutions and services, our employees are always poised for career advancement and growth. For more information, visit www.everonsolutions.com or follow us on LinkedIn.
The next generation of ADT Commercial is here. At Everon, we truly believe that our people are the difference – for our organization, the customers we serve and the communities we protect. When you’re a part of Everon, you’ll have the opportunity to be a part of that difference every day. With more than 100 locations, a deep national presence, and comprehensive portfolio of solutions and services, our employees are always poised for career advancement and growth. For more information, visit www.everonsolutions.com or follow us on LinkedIn.

**Position Highlights:**



This position will support a team of Recruiters on key administrative processes for fast paced, high volume recruitment. The Recruiting Coordinator is required to demonstrate unparalleled integrity and high energy while working under minimal supervision.





**Responsibilities & Qualifications:**


* Create and open requisitions via the company Applicant Tracking System (Horizon) ensuring that postings are managed for effectiveness and within appropriate guidelines/timeframes
* Create and extend offer letters via Applicant Tracking System (Horizon).
* Responsible for generating and managing the background verification/pre-employment process.
* Troubleshoot and assist candidates throughout the hiring process. Maintain solid candidate contact from offer acceptance to start date.
* Collaborate with and proactively support Recruiters, Hiring Managers and Candidates, providing superior customer service and candidate experiences throughout each step of the recruiting process
* Keep accurate record keeping via excel on all candidates in process and starts.
* Coordinate first day details with recruiter, hiring manager and local onboarding coordinator once start date is confirmed.
* Send first day instructions to candidate ensuring a positive onboarding experience.
* Participate in special projects on as needed basis.


**Education / Work Experience Required:**


* Associates or Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience
* Strong comfort level with Excel, ability to run reports as needed by Management
* Ability to multi-task in a dynamic environment
* Working knowledge of Horizon is preferred.
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Office
* Strong sense of urgency
* Must have excellent communication skills, both verb and written.

Must have superior follow through skills  
*

title: Publisher Onboarding Specialist
description:
Our company’s heart is to support the best content creators on the web, and as a Publisher Onboarding Specialist, we get to serve on the welcoming committee! We spend our days working through vital processes that contribute to the company’s success while also establishing relationships with new creators. This includes building trust throughout the process, coming up with creative ways to frame analytical data so that "non-numbers" people can understand it, and collaborating with a variety of internal teams to strategize and plan as we work toward making our services better for our community of creators.


As an Publisher Onboarding Specialist, you have experience in customer service and are the kind of person who enjoys helping people and going out of your way to make sure they’re happy. You understand the importance of a good first impression and have a keen sense of awareness about the human condition - how people are diverse, how they all need love and kindness. Helping someone in even the smallest way warms you to your core! You are an effective communicator, comfortable with change, and detail-oriented.

**What you’ll be doing:**

* Successfully preparing a creator for their ad install and setting expectations for their Raptive partnership
* Establishing an exceptional first impression of Raptive
* Building and maintaining strong relationships with creators
* Crafting thoughtful, detailed, and personal responses to creators in our support systems (Zendesk, Zoom, and LiveChat)
* Understanding ad layouts, earnings, and complex concepts and putting them into simple, clear terms
* Going above and beyond to provide creators with an exceptional, personalized experience
* Completing administrative tasks
* Collaborating with others and gathering data to find solutions
* Being an active member of a distributed team via tools like Slack, G Suite, Zoom, Salesforce, Confluence, and more

**The skills and experience you bring to the job:**

* 2+ years of experience in a customer-facing role
* Self-starter mentality - you know what needs to be done and don’t need someone to ask you to do it
* Excellent writing and communication skills
* Laser-focused attention to detail
* A willingness to learn new things and adapt quickly to change
* A high level of comfort working in a fast-paced, remote environment
* Analytical thinker with strong interpersonal skills
* Able to solve challenging problems and propose clear solutions
* Empathy, emotional intelligence, patience, a sense of humor, and some moderate GIF sharing abilities
* The motivation to try and make everything you touch better
* A genuine desire to help others solve problems and succeed
* Familiarity with current blogging trends and insights is a plus!
* Commitment to Raptive’s mission of serving creators

**About Raptive**


Raptive’s mission is to power creator independence. We’re a creator company that provides revenue, audience, business solutions, and much more for creators and enterprise publishers. Since the very beginning of digital content creation, we’ve been allies and advocates for every kind of creator and charted the uncharted to help creators grow their businesses through it all.


Today we are the catalyst for 5,000+ of the world’s most premium creators on the open web and rank as the tenth-largest digital property in the U.S. Creators who choose Raptive are premium content creators, trendsetters, iconic brands, and charismatic personalities, captivating more than 78% of U.S. audiences on their sites alone with the power to move and disrupt culture. They collectively rank #1 in Food, Family, Home, and Lifestyle-with a reach of more than 182M monthly unique visitors and more than half a billion followers across social platforms.


Creators are the future of media. And together, the future is ours to create.


The base salary range for this position is $45,000-$60,000. The range provided is Raptive’s reasonable estimate of the annualized base compensation for this role. The actual amount may be higher or lower, based on non-discriminatory factors such as experience, geographic location, knowledge, skills and abilities. This role is eligible for additional incentive compensation that isn’t included in the posted range.


For more information, visit www.Raptive.com or follow us on LinkedIn or Instagram.

*Raptive is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We believe we are most impactful when people with a wide range of backgrounds, experiences, and identities come together with a common purpose. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Raptive is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please reach out to a member of our recruiting team.*

title: Remote Full Desk Recruiter
description:
**The Roll is a 100% Commission** 

We are looking for a highly organized and diligent Full Desk Recruiter to join our staff. **Your chief duty in this role will be to source both employers and suitable employees.** Besides hiring adequate candidates for job positions within the company, you will also be responsible for finding and contacting potential clients and handling job orders. You will help us build a client network and keep up to date with the clients’ needs while also ensuring that the hiring processes run smoothly from start to finish.

Other duties you will assume in this role include the management of both clients’ and candidates’ portfolios—existing and new alike—and the fostering of relationships to acquire job order volume. A successful Full Desk Recruiter has to display a high level of self-accountability—they are expected to work independently and generate lead productivity with minimum or no supervision.

**Full Desk Recruiter Responsibilities**

* Source new clients and businesses, evaluate talent, and provide staffing services
* Search, source, and screen potential candidates for the roles available within the company
* Negotiate placements and uncover and resolve recruitment-related issues quickly and efficiently
* Regularly maintain and manage your portfolio of candidates and clients and prepare résumés for associates
* Regularly research and adopt the best market and commercial practices and adhere to internal recruitment policies
* Verify the recruitment practices are up to industry standards and aligned with the company’s objectives

**Full Desk Recruiter Requirements**

* 3+ years of commercial experience across a variety of fields—ideally in Staffing and Recruitment or B2B Sales
* Strong customer service and consultative sales skills
* Experience in sourcing practices, such as direct sourcing, passive candidate searching, networking, and applicant evaluation
* Excellent presentation skills
* Bachelor’s degree in Business or a related field preferred

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $50,842.00 - $51,782.00 per year

Experience level:

* 2 years

Experience:

* Recruiting: 2 years (Required)
* B2B: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Talent Acquisition & Onboarding Specialist
description:
Here at Atlantic Bay, we focus on genuinely caring for both our customers and team. We pride ourselves on being adaptable and energetic, especially in fast-paced environments! Our goal is to continuously inspire growth, for each of our team members to reach their goals and aspirations, all the while having fun. We’re in the business of lending peace of mind, whenever, wherever, however.



Atlantic Bay Mortgage Group, recently voted #1 in the nation as the best large mortgage company to work for by National Mortgage News, is seeking a **Talent Acquisition & Onboarding Specialist** to join our team. The Talent Acquisition & Onboarding Specialist is responsible for managing the movement of candidates through the full cycle recruitment process, from establishing a hiring need, to partnering with hiring managers, identifying qualified candidates to screening and interviewing candidates, and onboarding candidates to ensure a cultural and competent match.


**What you’ll be doing**


* Leveraging a variety of sources for recruitment advertising, including job boards, social media, referrals, outbound outreach, professional networking sites, etc., to proactively source candidates and build pipelines of highly qualified candidates for our Operations, Corporate, and Sales Support divisions.
* Building, growing, and maintaining industry peer relationships to foster opportunities to build a strong future candidate network.
* Partnering with hiring managers to fill open positions by getting requisitions entered and posting positions on the appropriate sites.
* Managing a broad candidate database from entry level to seasoned applicants and assisting with internal sourcing of candidates.
* Managing job postings and candidate stages in the Applicant Tracking System.
* Reviewing applications/resumes and conducting phone interviews while ensuring a positive candidate experience.
* Scheduling and communicating all interview logistics with candidates and interview teams.
* Conducting regular follow-up with the respective hiring managers and candidates to ensure timeliness and consistent communication throughout the recruitment process.
* Preparing and reviewing all onboarding documents to ensure the new hire has a positive experience joining Atlantic Bay.
* Adhering to and maintaining formal recruiting plan and procedures.
* Maintaining current knowledge of industry regulations, requirements, and trends.
* Performing other duties as assigned.


**What you’ll bring**


* A minimum of three years’ experience in the mortgage industry successfully sourcing and recruiting professional candidates for all levels within an organization required
* Experience utilizing an Applicant Tracking System; UKG preferred
* Working knowledge of employment laws, concepts, practices, and procedures
* Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, as well as presentation and interpersonal skills
* Superior customer service skills with the ability to establish and maintain relationships with internal and external customers
* Ability to work independently as well as within a team environment is required
* Ability to work collaboratively
* Must be flexible and able to adapt to change while prioritizing tasks and efficiently managing time
* Must have robust organization and administrative skills


**Perks**



Atlantic Bay offers a dynamic benefits package that includes a competitive base salary, eligibility for monthly bonuses, health insurance, 401(k), PTO, paid volunteer time and your birthday off with pay! Who doesn't love that!


**If you have a passion for helping people lead their best life; Come ride the wave home to Atlantic Bay!**



#GrowWithUs #WorkLifeBalance

title: Recruiting Researcher, Product
description:
Our client, the world’s leading entertainment streaming service, is looking for a **Recruiting Researcher, Product,** who will help build their Advertising and Product teams. You will source and screen candidates across a variety of pipelines and will partner closely with members of the Talent Acquisition team.

  



This is a **remote 9-month contract.** You must be in the US, with no H1B Visa status. Hourly rate **$65.00** per hour plus benefits through Talent Table. **No C2C.**

  


**Responsibilities:**


* Partner with recruiters and recruiting researchers to understand specific needs to attract and
* engage with top talent in Advertising, Product Management, Product Discovery & Promotion, and User Experience Design organizations.
* In partnership with a recruiter and/or recruiting researcher, you will determine appropriate ways to develop and build out talent pipelines.
* Enact inclusive and diverse sourcing strategies, identifying approaches to broadening representation in pipelines.
* Find, engage, and activate passive candidates through the use of Boolean, LinkedIn, and alternative search techniques. Additionally, you’ll provide inbound sourcing support for roles with a high volume of applicants or similar candidate profiles.
* Assess or screen candidates through a consistent and structured review process.

  


**Who You Are:**


* 5+ years of Talent Acquisition experience, with at least 1 year of high-volume sourcing experience.
* Proven success in developing strong talent pipelines, ideally within Advertising, Product Management, Creative, or UX Design industries.
* Self-motivated and driven; you look for solutions and impact, without being asked twice.
* Curious; you look to dig deeper beyond the surface level of a job profile researching market trends, domain technology, and seek out information to have a solid understanding of the business. You ask for feedback, and want to grow and develop in your career.
* Accustomed to multitasking, meeting multiple deadlines, and maintaining data integrity.
* You leverage data (qualitative and quantitative) to track your progress and to inform decisions.

title: Technical Strategic Sourcer (100% Remote) W2 Only - Remote
description:
**Work options:** Remote  

* 9 Month contract opportunity - W2 (No C2C)
* Compensation: $60 - $65/hr
* 100% Remote

  

Intuitive Surgical, in cooperation with our recruitment partner Raise, are hiring. We’re a global technology leader in minimally invasive care and a pioneer of robotic-assisted surgery. Working closely with hospital teams, we’re developing integrated solutions that help enable physicians to get patients back to what matters most. Our technology has been used in nearly 10 million operations across 67 countries.


Together, we’ve dedicated more than two decades for innovating for better care through enhanced experiences, improved efficiencies, and reduced cost of care. In this role, you will join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients.

 **Primary Function of Position:**


The Technical Strategic Sourcer is a key member of the Strategic Sourcing team, actively pursuing external passive talent. As a forward-thinking expert at building pipelines, you will create, steer, and evolve a passive talent strategy to ensure we identify, develop relationships with, and hire the best talent in the market. You will own sourcing-related processes and initiatives and create a "Center of Excellence" for your strategic skillsets.

 **Roles & Responsibilities:**


This position has responsibility and authority to:

* Develop and execute sourcing strategies aimed at generating candidate flow to meet overall recruiting goals. Develop and implement tactical strategies for generating qualified leads.
* Conduct searches from individual contributor up to director level, managing multiple searches at any one time.
* Understand highly technical requirements – including skillsets within Mechanical Engineering, Robotics, Human Factors, Embedded Software Engineering, Supplier Engineering, etc.
* Execute multi-faceted sourcing strategy to include resurfacing and generating leads using recruitment tools, i.e., web, research lists, referrals, job fairs, ATS, CRM, ERP etc.
* Act as an expert on the employment marketplace, providing market information and knowledge to recruiters and hiring managers to influence hiring decisions.
* Provide a white glove candidate experience with every interaction.
* Attend strategy meetings with recruiters and hiring managers to gain a better understanding of job requirements. Provide advice and guidance to recruiters and hiring managers regarding local candidate pools, enabling better decision making about hiring strategies.
* Build ongoing candidate pipelines for future openings.
* Screen and assess interested candidates for fit for the organization and role and provide recommendations on candidates to interview.
* Monitor trends and developments in sourcing tools and technologies and utilize social media for sourcing and other marketing forums.
* Drive initiatives to enhance candidate sourcing strategies.
* Utilize and maintain Contact Management and Applicant Tracking Systems

 **Skills, Experience, Education, & Training:**

* Requires a minimum of 2+ years of experience with demonstrated expertise in sourcing top technical talent within any of the following skillsets: Mechanical Engineering, Robotics, Human Factors, Embedded Software Engineering, Supplier Engineering, etc.
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent.
* Recruiting agency experience highly preferred.
* Experience with a metrics driven role.
* Proven ability to consistently and positively contribute in a high-paced, changing work environment as well as the ability to prioritize multiple functions and tasks and manage work time efficiently.
* Good judgment in selecting methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for obtaining results.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks/projects simultaneously.
* Ability to build external and internal relationships and develop networks to identify talent.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and networking skills, professional and personable phone presence.
* Flexibility to meet changing business requirements.
* A proactive approach and responsiveness are critical.
* Experience working with an automated Applicant Tracking System is preferred.
* Ability to travel up to 15%.

  

Please note that this is a contract role providing services to Intuitive through our direct sourcing partner, Raise who manages Intuitive’s Contractor Talent Community. If you are selected for this role, you will be employed by Raise and will not be an employee of Intuitive.


Work with an Award Winning Employer:

* Best Places to Work, Glassdoor Employees’ Choice, 2019 (#12 of 100), 2020 (#7 of 100)
* America’s Best Midsized Employers, Forbes, 2019 (#149 of 500)
* Top 150 Places to Work in Healthcare, Becker’s Hospital Review, 2019
* Top CEOs, Glassdoor, 2019 (#9 of 100)


Raise and Intuitive are Equal Employment Opportunity Employers. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees, and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type, without regard to race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, genetic information or any other status protected under federal, state, or local applicable laws. We will consider for employment all qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws.

title: Patient Recruiter (Patient Registration)
description:
### **Description**

  

Alcanza is a growing multi-site, multi-phase clinical research company with a network of locations in MA, NH, MI, VA, SC, FL, GA and AL. We have established a strong presence across Phase I-IV studies and several therapeutic areas including vaccine, neurology, dermatology, psychiatry, and general medicine. Join us as we continue to grow.
  

  

The **Patient Recruiter** is responsible for planning, organizing, and implementing recruitment programs to successfully meet targeted enrollment goals for study protocols and enroll appropriate subjects in protocols.### **Key Responsibilities**

  

**Essential Job Duties:**  

* Ability to phone screen patients or caregivers in caring and empathetic manner.
* Document patient information correctly in the computer database
* Schedule/reschedule patient screen and prescreen appointments.
* Manage incoming calls from patients interested in taking part in research studies.
* Evaluate eligibility of potential subjects through methods such as screening interviews, reviews of medical records, or discussions with site clinic staff.
* Learn and maintain knowledge regarding clinical research studies including inclusion and exclusion criteria for different studies.
* Record contact status of patients and document information in the database.
* Review, call and update sponsor patient portals as needed.
* Perform all other duties that may be requested or assigned.

  

### **Skills, Knowledge and Expertise**

  

**Minimum Qualifications**: A high school diploma, or equivalent, and a minimum of 6 months experience in a medical environment, customer service, call center or a similar field is required. MA, CNA, LPN/LVN, EMT or other medical license is preferred. Experience with calendar management /scheduling and Clinical trial management system experience is preferred but not required.  

**Required Skills:**  

* Proficiency with computer applications such as email, electronic health records, and basic applications.
* Ability to type proficiently (40+ wpm).
* Must possess strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and have basic math proficiency.
* Well-developed written and verbal communication skills. Bi-lingual (English / Spanish) proficiency is highly preferred.
* Well-developed listening skills and the ability to work well alone as well as in a team atmosphere.
* Ability to handle multiple tasks and changes in workloads and priorities.
* Ability to be professional, respectful of others, self-motivated, and exemplify a strong work ethic.
* Must possess a high degree of honesty and dependability.
* Ability to work under minimal supervision, identify problems and help find solutions.
* Ability to handle highly sensitive patient health information in a confidential and professional manner, and in compliance with HIPAA guidelines.

### **Benefits**

  

* Full-time employees regularly scheduled to work at least 30 hours per week are benefits-eligible, with coverage starting on the first day of the month following date of hire.
* Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short and long-term disability insurance, health savings accounts, supplemental insurances, and a 401k plan with a safe harbor match are offered.

### **About Alcanza Clinical Research**


Alcanza Clinical Research (“Alcanza”) is a national, collaborative network of clinical research sites, founded on the mission to accelerate the development of new therapies by reducing barriers to clinical research participation for all.
  

  

We conduct research on dozens of conditions in several therapeutic areas including psychiatry, neurology, dermatology, and infectious disease. Our work is important to the patients who participate, the scientists who develop these new therapies, and the entire medical community. Because all approved medications require clinical trials, the impact of your work is exponential, reaching many thousands of future patients and improving their quality of life.
  

  

Alcanza is a culturally competent organization. We treat each other with dignity, creating an environment where all individuals feel welcome, heard, and respected for their unique perspectives and aspirations. We put considerable effort into finding exceptional employees who mirror the values most important to us: Inclusive, Impactful, Compassionate, and Determined.
  

  

**Alcanza Clinical Research is an Equal Opportunity Employer** that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, marital status, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, or any other category protected by law. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.

title: Recruiter (Temporary)
description:
We are a fast-paced business with ambitious growth plans; so if you are dedicated, enthusiastic and always seeking ways to improve, you'll enjoy a career with us!
Ontic offers a new lease on life for the aerospace and defense industry. We’re dedicated to providing a safe, diverse, and evolving work environment. We work with integrity, responsibility, safety, and accountability through inspiring, engaging and collaborating to achieve a common goal — whether that’s serving our customers, helping each other, or volunteering in our local community.
Our team is looking for a Temporary Recruiter to join them for approximately 12 months. You will report to the US Recruitment Manager and will have a remote work schedule.
To be considered for the Recruiter role, here’s what you’ll need to bring with you:* A bachelor’s degree in a related field.
* 2+ years of experience in full lifecycle recruitment, preferably in a manufacturing environment.
* Experience with HRIS/ATS, such as Workday.

  

As a Recruiter, you will:* Own and manage full lifecycle recruitment for roles at various levels across the US.
* Hold recruitment strategy intake sessions with hiring leaders to gather relevant details about the positions.
* Prepare job advertisements, inclusive of marketing material for other job boards (i.e., LinkedIn, Indeed).
* Conduct resume reviews to ensure candidates meet the basic minimum requirements.
* Define and execute effective candidate sourcing strategies/techniques.
* Develop and maintain strong partnerships with hiring leaders and HR professionals globally.
* Ensure accuracy and completion of candidate records/statuses within Workday.
* Partner with Recruitment Coordinator on the interview scheduling and pre-employment onboarding processes.
* Participate in process improvement initiatives or other projects as required.


Our Benefits:* Comprehensive medical insurance
* Competitive PTO, holiday pay, and sick leave
* Company 401K plan with up to 4% matched contribution
* Annual bonus program (varies by level and discretionary based on company and individual performance)
* Flexible working arrangements
* Paid volunteering opportunities
* Access to mental health champions across our sites
* Commitment to development
* Employee referral program


Salary Range:* $80,000- $100,000/year, based on experience

title: Sourcing Specialist
description:
**Job Title-** Sourcing Specialist

**Department-** Flight Operations Center

**Reports to-** Director, Account Management & Sourcing

**Location**- Remote

**Who we are-**


As a wholly owned subsidiary of Elevate Aviation Group, Private Jet Services (PJS) is an aviation consultancy and air travel solutions company serving an extensive clientele across diverse industries. Global clientele includes government agencies, presidential candidates, professional and collegiate sports teams, family offices, multinational corporations, and some of the world’s most recognized entrepreneurs, entertainers, and high-net-worth individuals. PJS is ever ready to dispatch customized travel itineraries 24 hours a day, 365 days of the year to any destination.

**Summary of position-**


The Sourcing Specialist will support the outside sales, large group charter, and account management teams by sourcing aircraft to satisfy the requests of PJS’s current and potential clients. They are an expert in aircraft types, performance and limitations, and market pricing to competitively position aircraft for proposals.


.

**Essential Duties & Responsibilities-**

* Source aircraft for all incoming flight requests from the outside sales, large group charter, and account management teams.
* Create and send proposals to clients, to include aircraft positioning and competitive margin.
* Find options for immediate charters and recovering AOG situations.
* Sign contracts for all off-fleet trips.
* Develop and maintain relationships with PJS’s preferred network of operators.
* Collaborate with internal teams to solve any issues in a timely fashion.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Knowledge, Skills & Abilities-**

* Ability to grow company culture and act as an ambassador of the PJS brand.
* Commercial acumen – possesses proven experience of identifying commercially viable opportunities and negotiating deals.
* A keen eye for detail that will enable you to move quickly while maintaining exacting levels of accuracy in your work.
* Advanced organizational skills and the ability to multitask, while keeping up with high demand.
* Business aviation industry expert.
* Proficiency in CRM software and MS Office Suite.
* High degree of confidentiality and discretion.

**Education & Experience-**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.
* Approximately 1-2 years’ aviation brokerage experience, including experience with aircraft operations.

**Schedule & Travel-**

* Standard business hours are expected in this role, with the ability to work outside normal business hours and/or holidays as needed.
* Ability to travel as required up to 10%.

**Miscellaneous-**

* FLSA Status- Full Time exempt.
* Lifting requirements- Up to 20lbs.

**About Elevate Aviation Group-**


Elevate Aviation Group, established in 2003, provides air transportation, travel consultancy, aircraft acquisitions and aircraft management services to some of the most recognized names in business, sports, entertainment, government, and higher education. Elevate Aviation Group’s wholly owned subsidiaries, Private Jet Services, Elevate Jet, and Elevate MRO, share a mission to provide aircraft owners and flyers unsurpassed service, safety, and counsel. Whether clients require charter flights, large group travel, aircraft management services, aircraft maintenance or aircraft acquisition services, Elevate Aviation Group delivers highly personalized solutions to meet each client’s unique needs 24 hours a day, 365 days of the year to any destination.

description:

title: Specialist, Talent Acquisition
description:
Description:

As the Specialist, Talent Acquisition, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our global workforce by developing and implementing effective talent acquisition strategies. This hands-on role requires proven leadership skills in managing, and performing, end-to-end recruitment processes.

**Essential Functions:**

**Talent Acquisition Strategy:**

* Develop and implement a comprehensive talent acquisition strategy aligned with organizational workforce needs and objectives.
* Identify areas of improvement in the recruitment process and implement innovative solutions.
* Continuously monitor industry trends to adapt the strategy and attract top-tier talent.

**Recruitment Process:**

* Manage the end-to-end recruitment process, from job requisition to offer acceptance.
* Whiteboard, evaluate, and redesign the domestic and international recruiting processes to implement best practices in candidate sourcing, assessment, and selection
* Evaluate and implement a global ATS tool
* Ensure a seamless, repeatable, and positive candidate experience.
* Coach and consult global teams on interview and hiring best practices and processes.

**Global Recruiting:**

* Support global recruiting end-to-end, ensuring consistency and efficiency.
* Prioritize and manage global hiring volume based on organizational needs.

**Collaboration:**

* Build strong relationships with department heads and hiring managers to understand their staffing needs.
* Work closely with leadership to align recruitment efforts with organizational goals.
* Coordinate with Regional HRBP teammates to ensure compliance with employment laws and company policies.

**Employer Branding:**

* In partnership with marcom, develop and maintain the company's employer brand to attract top talent.
* Utilize social media, industry events, and other channels to promote the organization's reputation as an employer of choice.

**Data Analysis and Reporting:**

* Develop and build TA Dashboards to assess and report on metrics and key performance indicators related to the recruitment process, guiding decisions based on data.
* Collaborate with the leadership team to assess and steer accountability and decision-making processes based on data-driven insights.

**Continuous Improvement:**

* Stay current on industry best practices and emerging trends in talent acquisition.
* Suggest and implement process improvements to enhance the effectiveness of the recruitment function.


Requirements:  

* Bachelor’s degree in HR, Business, or a related field. Master's degree is a plus.
* 5+ years of experience in talent acquisition, with at least 1-2 years in a leadership or management role.
* 2+ years of experience recruiting globally for NGO’s is a plus
* Experience in an HR generalist or HR Business Partner role is preferred.
* Strong understanding of recruitment tools and technologies.
* Proven ability to lead and develop a high-performing recruitment team.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
* Well-versed in multi-state/global employment laws and regulations.
* Proficiency in data analysis and reporting.
* Certification in HR or Talent Acquisition is a plus.

**Competencies:**

* Strong leadership, consulting, and people management skills with the ability to inspire and motivate teams to cross the finish line.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities, with the capacity to build relationships at all organizational levels.
* Strategic mindset with a focus on aligning HR initiatives with overall business goals.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to make data-driven decisions.

title: Recruitment Manager
description:
We are seeking a highly driven and organized Recruiting Manager to oversee the recruitment of tour guides for the variety of tours, including ghost tours, food tours, brewery tours, history tours, and more.

***This is a remote W-2 role and not a contract position. You must reside within the United States and be fluent in the English language.***

**Job Description**

The Recruiting Manager will be responsible for leading the recruitment and selection process for the tour guides. This individual will work closely with department managers to understand their staffing needs, develop and implement effective recruitment strategies, and identify and attract the best talent for the company.

**Recruiting Manager Skills and Expertise:**

* Develop and implement recruiting strategies: This includes determining the best sources for attracting candidates, establishing relationships with colleges and universities, and identifying opportunities for diversity recruiting.
* Manage the hiring process: This includes coordinating interviews, negotiating offers, and ensuring a smooth onboarding process for new hires.
* Source and screen candidates: This includes conducting initial phone screens, evaluating resumes, and conducting in-person interviews.
* Position may require some social media management: reply to messages and make occasional posts.
* Use data to drive decision-making: This includes tracking key recruiting metrics, analyzing trends, and making data-driven recommendations to improve the recruiting process.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices.
* Ensure compliance with all relevant laws and regulations: This includes staying current with equal employment opportunity laws and immigration regulations.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications:**

The ideal candidate for a Recruiting Manager position will have a bachelor's degree in human resources, business, or a related field, and 2 years of experience in recruitment and staffing. Strong leadership skills, excellent communication skills, and a deep understanding of the hiring process are also critical for success in this role.

* Excellent time management skills and the ability to organize work
* Ability to manage multiple projects with competing priorities
* Common sense approach to problem-solving
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy
* Excellent oral and written communication skills: the ability to diffuse customer complaints both on the phone and in written responses to emails, instant messages, and online reviews.
* Proficiency with Google Docs, Microsoft Office and Dropbox preferred
* Professional and dependable with a positive outlook required

**We offer:**

* Competitive Compensation - Best-in-Industry Pay
* Health Benefits
* Paid Time Off – 80 Hours
* Sick Pay – 5 Days
* Remote Work Monday to Friday
* A steep learning curve and growth trajectory based on individual performance.
* We offer a positive environment where growth is encouraged and supported by experienced leaders.
* Our collaborative approach provides plenty of opportunities to work as a team. So, if you are looking for career growth where your work makes an impact then you are the right fit for us!

**Zaal Ventures is a remote company.**

**Zaal Ventures is a Veteran-Friendly Employer. We value the perspectives, backgrounds, skills, work ethic and leadership that those who are military connected bring to the workforce.**

**As part of our People First culture, Zaal Ventures is proud to offer a robust and competitive Total Rewards benefits package.**

**Zaal Ventures is an Equal Opportunity Employer that celebrates diversity and believes employing a diverse workforce is key to our success. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all individuals.**

**We are not able to sponsor work visas for this position.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $42,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Experience:

* Recruiting: 5 years (Required)
* Human Resources: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Staffing/Talent Acquisition Coordinator, (Remote)
description:

Provides administrative support for the human resources function in the area of employment. Schedules, screens and coordinates interviews between the potential candidate, hiring manager and recruiter. Maintains candidate files and processes paper work from the initiation of the requisition to the new hire paper work. May screen, evaluate and conduct reference checks on candidates. title: Talent Acquisition Specialist
description:
About Coalfire

**Coalfire is on a mission to make the world a safer place by solving our clients’ toughest cybersecurity challenges. We work at the cutting edge of technology to advise, assess, automate, and ultimately help companies navigate the ever-changing cybersecurity landscape. We are headquartered in Denver, Colorado with offices across the U.S. and U.K., and we support clients around the world.**


**But that’s not who we are – that’s just what we do.**
=======================================================

**We are thought leaders, consultants, and cybersecurity experts, but above all else, we are a team of passionate problem-solvers who are hungry to learn, grow, and make a difference.**
=========================================================================================================================================================================================

**And we’re growing fast.**
===========================

**We’re looking for a Talent Acquisition Specialist to support our Talent Acquisition team.**
=============================================================================================

  

Work with Leaders of Talent Acquisition team to identify ways to provide a best-in-class candidate experience, review processes across all touch points of the candidate and hiring manager lifecycle. The Talent Acquisition Specialist will also be a strategic thought-partner in collaboration with other HR teams (Operations, HRBP team, etc.) in support of long-term company expansion and growth. Responsible for delivering and expanding our TA processes, tools, systems, and data analytics which enable the recruiting team to grow the company and take us to the next stage of our transformation.

  

Provide process and system support for the Talent Acquisition team including, all on-boarding activity, researching and resolving system problems, unexpected results or process flaws, perform scheduled activities, recommend solutions or alternate methods to meet requirements.

**What You’ll Do**
==================

* Build out recruiting metrics, reporting, and dashboards leveraging internal tools and making recommendations for new metrics
* Identify opportunities for operational excellence, both efficiency and effectiveness
* Support building a world-class candidate experience and ensure that both the vision and execution are shared company-wide
* Manage relationship and accountability with background check vendors, being involved in escalated incidences where on-time completion is not expected
* Act as ATS (Lever) subject matter expert across the business; own all account creation, troubleshooting, and reporting within Lever
* Lead weekly new hire orientation in partnership with other HR team members; presenting on benefits and enrollment, trainings, and answering new hire questions to provide the best first day experience possible for our new employees
* Develop and deliver new user training on systems and processes, and collaborate on creation and distribution of training material to relevant stakeholders
* Establish consistency in the interview structure and process including how we leverage our system in partnership with TA leaders

**What You’ll Bring**
=====================

* Minimum 4 years of Talent acquisition, onboarding, and operations experience
* Deep understanding of modern Applicant Tracking Systems (knowledge of Lever preferred)
* Experience working successfully in a high-growth, fast-paced environment
* Advanced abilities in Microsoft Office tools and ATS reporting tools
* Proven use of data and analytics to drive decisions
* Be a self-starter with a passion for recruiting, a high level of flexibility, commitment, and the ability to tackle ambiguity
* Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously and meet deadlines
* Proven ability to successfully work both independently and collaboratively to accomplish operational goals
* Confident communicator who can establish new processes, provide appropriate documentation, and train others accordingly
* Strong Data Analysis skills

**Why You’ll Want to Join Us**
==============================


At Coalfire, you’ll find the support you need to thrive personally and professionally. In many cases, we provide a flexible work model that empowers you to choose when and where you’ll work most effectively – whether you’re at home or an office.


Regardless of location, you’ll experience a company that prioritizes connection and wellbeing and be part of a team where people care about each other and our communities. You’ll have opportunities to join employee resource groups, participate in in-person and virtual events, and more. And you’ll enjoy competitive perks and benefits to support you and your family, like paid parental leave, flexible time off, certification and training reimbursement, digital mental health and wellbeing support membership, and comprehensive insurance options.


At Coalfire, equal opportunity and pay equity is integral to the way we do business. A reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role is $MIN to $MAX based on national salary averages. The actual salary offer to the successful candidate will be based on job-related education, geographic location, training, licensure and certifications and other factors. You may also be eligible to participate in annual incentive, commission, and/or recognition programs. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist
description:
Description:
**Job Summary**


As a Talent Acquisition Specialist, you will be instrumental in attracting, sourcing, and hiring exceptional talent to support our organization's strategic objectives. You will work closely with hiring managers and department leaders to understand their staffing needs and develop effective recruitment strategies to identify and engage top candidates. This role requires a proactive approach to talent acquisition, strong networking skills, and the ability to deliver a positive candidate experience.

**Major Responsibilities/Activities**

* Talent Sourcing: Utilize a variety of sourcing methods, including online job boards, social media platforms, professional networking sites, and employee referrals, to identify and attract qualified candidates. Lead onboarding of new hires by initiating the required paperwork, conducting required OIG background screenings, updating Supervisors and the IT Department of new hires, and other administrative tasks associated with onboarding as needed.
* Candidate Engagement: Proactively reach out to potential candidates and build relationships to effectively communicate our employer brand and career opportunities.
* Candidate Screening: Review resumes, conduct phone screens, and interview candidates to assess their skills, experience, and fit for the role and the organization.
* Interview Coordination: Coordinate and schedule interviews with hiring managers and stakeholders, ensuring a smooth and efficient interview process for both candidates and interviewers.
* Employer Branding: Contribute to the development and promotion of our employer brand through various channels, including social media, industry events, and networking opportunities.
* Pipeline Management: Build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future hiring needs, keeping candidates engaged and informed throughout the recruitment process.
* Data Analysis: Track key recruitment metrics and analyze hiring data to evaluate the effectiveness of recruitment strategies and identify areas for improvement.
* Compliance: Ensure compliance with all relevant employment laws and regulations throughout the recruitment process.

**Other Responsibilities/Activities**

* Perform various administrative tasks necessary for legal compliance, tracking and measurement, and/or operation of the HR department
* Perform accurate & timely data entry and run reports that may include confidential personnel information
* Conduct audit procedures consistent with established HR audit process
* Perform administration duties for applicant tracking system


Requirements:
**Required Education, Skills, & Experience**

* Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Human Resources, Business Administration, or other related field or at least one year direct experience in employment & recruiting
* Working knowledge of human resources principles, practices, and employment laws; ability to research, read, comprehend, and apply legal principles and applicable laws in a fast-paced business environment
* Possession of the skills and ability to apply sound judgment and decision-making in a variety of situations that may include high levels of emotion, difficult topics, and potential financial or legal risk
* Extremely strong sense of confidentiality and professionalism regarding personnel information and sensitive subjects
* Highly organized with the ability to manage time, prioritize work effectively, and remain productive amid frequent interruptions
* Meticulous and thorough attention to detail, accuracy, and deadlines
* Excellent oral and written communication skills and presentation skills
* Must be able to give and receive positive and negative feedback in a consistent, professional, and respectful manner
* Must be able to communicate and manage sensitive and sometimes difficult information in a professional, composed, and confident manner
* Strong customer/personal service skills
* Ability to manage multiple projects and tasks at a time, successfully to completion and on time
* Must be committed to the highest level of business and ethical standards and consistently display integrity, composure, and behavior in line with the company’s vision and values
* Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and Power Point
* Strong sense of pride and ownership in own work performance and development
* Willing and able to adapt to changes in work environment, procedures, priorities, stress, and job duties
* Strong work ethic with the ability to identify what needs to be done, complete tasks, and meet deadlines with enthusiasm and little supervision

**Preferred Education, Skills, & Experience**

* PHR or SPHR certification preferred
* Proficiency in Paylocity

**Working Environment/Physical Requirements**

* General office environment
* Typing, sitting, standing, walking, some light lifting
* Use of basic office equipment such as PC, fax, printer, copier, phone
* Occasional travel, normally short trips

title: Dental Network Recruiter
description:
Join us for an exciting career with the leading provider of supplemental benefits!
Our Promise  

Through skill-building, leadership development and philanthropic opportunities, we provide opportunities to build communities and grow your career, surrounded by diverse colleagues with high ethical standards.
Our Dental Network Provider Recruitment department is seeking a motivated Network Recruiter who will be responsible for developing stable provider network and facilitate key recruitment processes which will enable broad member access. In an assigned territory, you’ll source individuals and provider groups from diverse places of service, including general and specialist offices, university medical centers, state and federally funded healthcare facilities, medical conferences, and other unique ways. In addition, you’ll also educate providers and office staff on insurance plans, fees, and administrative plan requirements.
Our chosen candidate will understand that a strategic approach is crucial for success; someone who understands that targeted marketing, telephone and video campaigns along with other creative ways of reaching decision makers are critical for network expansion.
* Plan and execute daily recruitment call schedules and approaches.
* Use network adequacy data to identify gaps in existing networks and recruit providers to remain competitive and compliant with state and federal regulations.
* Complete and maintain recruitment tracking reports.
* Facilitate credentialing intakes.
* Complete special projects as assigned.


Requirements:* High school diploma or equivalent required; Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience that directly relates to the essential job functions also required.
* Two (2+) years of demonstrated experience in a Dental office, Dental Organization or similar field required.
* Competence in provider contracts and fee schedule components - from both providers’ and payers’ perspectives - and the impact of proposed changes.
* Capability to travel 10% or more, as needed.
* Strong written and verbal communication with both providers, their office staff and within internal Avesis departments.
* Ability to analyze data and package results in easy-to-understand formats to express results succinctly.
* Proficiency with MS Office (specifically Excel), and an exposure to different industry software’s to implement recruitment efforts is highly desirable.
* Ability to multi-task and work in an ever-changing, fast-paced environment.
* Critical thinking, attention to detail and strong organizational skills required.


FLSA Status: Salary/Exempt
Hourly Range: $55,790 - $87,230
How to stay safe:
Avesis is aware of fraudulent activity by individuals falsely representing themselves as Avesis recruiters. In some instances, these individuals may even contact applicants with a job offer letter, ask applicants to make purchases (i.e., a laptop or gift cards) from a designated vendor, have applicants fill out W-2 forms, or ask that applicants ship or send packages of goods to the company.
Avesis would never make such requests to applicants at any time throughout our job application process. We also would never ask applicants for personal information, such as passport numbers, bank account numbers, or social security numbers, during process. Our recruitment process takes place by phone and via trusted business communication platform (i.e., Zoom, Webex, Microsoft Teams, etc.). Any emails from Avesis recruiters will come from a verified email address ending in @Avesis.com.
We urge all applicants to exercise caution. If something feels off about your interactions, we encourage you to suspend or cease communications. If you are unsure of the legitimacy of a communication you have received, please reach out to ITsupport@Avesis.com.
To learn more about protecting yourself from fraudulent activity, please refer to this article link (https://consumer.ftc.gov/articles/how-avoid-scam). If you believe you were a victim of fraudulent activity, please contact your local authorities or file a complaint (Link: https://reportfraud.ftc.gov/#/) with the Federal Trade Commission. Avesis is not responsible for any claims, losses, damages, or expenses resulting from unaffiliated individuals of the company or their fraudulent activity.
We Offer* Meaningful and challenging work opportunities to accelerate innovation in a secure and compliant way.
* Competitive compensation package.
* Excellent medical, dental, supplemental health, life and vision coverage for you and your dependents with no wait period.
* Life and disability insurance.
* A great 401(k) with company match.
* Tuition assistance, paid parental leave and backup family care.
* Dynamic, modern work environments that promote collaboration and creativity to develop and empower talent.
* Flexible time off, dress code, and work location policies to balance your work and life in the ways that suit you best.
* Employee Resource Groups that advocate for inclusion and diversity in all that we do.
* Social responsibility in all aspects of our work. We volunteer within our local communities, create educational alliances with colleges, drive a variety of initiatives in sustainability.


Equal Employment Opportunity
At Avēsis, We See You. We celebrate differences and are building a culture of inclusivity and diversity. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers all qualified applicants and does not discriminate against any person based on ancestry, age, citizenship, color, creed, disability, familial status, gender, gender expression, gender identity, marital status, military or veteran status, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic. At Avēsis, we believe that, to operate at the peak of excellence, our workforce needs to represent a rich mixture of diverse people, all focused on providing a world-class experience for our clients. We focus on recruiting, training and retaining those individuals that share similar goals. Come Dare to be Different at Avēsis, where We See You!

title: Ford Manufacturing Recruiter
description:
Are you looking to take your recruiting career to the next level? Sustainable Talent and Ford are teaming up to help scale its Manufacturing organization. We have an immediate opening for a high-volume experienced recruiter from assembly line manufacturing to management level with a great work ethic, a high sense of urgency and dynamic energy to join our growing team. In this position, you’ll be part of a high-performing recruiting team designed help Ford bring electric zero-emission vehicles at scale to American customers with the largest, most advanced, most efficient auto production complex in its 118-year history.


If you thrive in a fast-paced and high-volume environment, this could be a great fit for you!

***Responsibilities:***

* Create and run large-scale hiring events to hire for skill trades to management-level positions
* Community outreach at all levels to help create opportunities and improve people's lives
* Conduct intake meetings with hiring managers to understand needs, ensuring alignment between job descriptions, and target candidate profiles
* Persistent pursuit of passive candidates via personalized reach-outs
* Be an advocate for DEI both internally and externally
* Screen candidates to assess suitability for current and future positions
* Partner with hiring managers and create strategies to effectively hire in remote locations
* Regularly manage pipeline activity and maintain data integrity, and proactively share data-centric updates with internal stakeholders
* Establish and maintain meaningful relationships with management and key cross-functional stakeholders internally

***Qualifications:***

* Experience with creative sourcing of Salaried and Hourly candidates in a Manufacturing environment.
* Great communication skills, articulate and ready to take charge of the situation
* You look to dig deeper beyond the surface level of a job profile; researching market trends and domain technology and seeking out information to have a solid understanding of the business
* Expertise in full-cycle recruiting and running hiring events
* Proficiency with handling hard to close candidates in a competitive market
* Experience or exposure recruiting from trade schools and local community organizations
* Automotive/Manufacturing Recruiting/Sourcing experience strongly preferred

***What's in it for you?***


Our winning formula for results is simple – attract and retain immensely talented people. Our clients range from explosive start-ups to several of the most respected leaders in their industries including Uber, Nvidia, Ford, and Home Depot to name a few. From health to wealth to well-being, Sustainable Talent believes our people deserve the best. We offer our team members a competitive, comprehensive benefits program and resources to enhance and foster professional development.

*Sustainable Talent is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.*

title: Senior Sourcing Specialist
description:
**Job Title-** Senior Sourcing Specialist

**Department-** PJS Account Management POD

**Reports to-** Director, Account Management & Sourcing

**Location-** Remote

**Who we are-**


As a wholly owned subsidiary of Elevate Aviation Group, Private Jet Services (PJS) is an aviation consultancy and air travel solutions company serving an extensive clientele across diverse industries. Global clientele includes government agencies, presidential candidates, professional and collegiate sports teams, family offices, multinational corporations, and some of the world’s most recognized entrepreneurs, entertainers, and high-net-worth individuals. PJS is ever ready to dispatch customized travel itineraries 24 hours a day, 365 days of the year to any destination.

**Summary of position-**


The Senior Sourcing Specialist is responsible for developing and managing the sourcing function within the Account Management POD. They will support the outside sales, large group charter, and account management teams by sourcing aircraft to satisfy the requests of PJS’s current and potential clients. They are an expert in aircraft types, performance and limitations, and market pricing to competitively position aircraft for proposals. The Senior Sourcing Specialist is responsible for training and mentoring the team of Sourcing Specialists.

*.*

**Essential Duties & Responsibilities-**

* Source aircraft for all incoming flight requests from the outside sales, large group charter, and account management teams.
* Create and send proposals to clients, to include aircraft positioning and competitive margin.
* Find options for immediate charters and recovering AOG situations.
* Sign contracts for all off-fleet trips.
* Develop and maintain relationships with PJS’s preferred network of operators.
* Partner with Sales Executives to negotiate with PJS’s partner network to obtain the best possible pricing and increase overall win rates.
* Collaborate with internal teams to solve any issues in a timely fashion.
* Train and mentor the Sourcing team within the Account Management POD.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Knowledge, Skills & Abilities-**

* Ability to grow company culture and act as an ambassador of the PJS brand.
* Commercial acumen – possesses proven experience of identifying commercially viable opportunities and negotiating deals.
* A keen eye for detail that will enable you to move quickly while maintaining exacting levels of accuracy in your work.
* Advanced organizational skills and the ability to multitask, while keeping up with high demand.
* Business aviation industry expert.
* Proficiency in CRM software and MS Office Suite.
* High degree of confidentiality and discretion.

**Education & Experience-**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.
* Approximately 2-4 years’ aviation brokerage experience, including experience with aircraft operations.
* 2+ years’ experience sourcing aircraft.

**Schedule & Travel-**

* Standard business hours are expected in this role, with the ability to work outside normal business hours and/or holidays as needed.
* Ability to travel as required up to 10%.

**Miscellaneous-**

* FLSA Status- Full Time exempt.
* Lifting requirements- Up to 20lbs.

**About Elevate Aviation Group-**


Elevate Aviation Group, established in 2003, provides air transportation, travel consultancy, aircraft acquisitions and aircraft management services to some of the most recognized names in business, sports, entertainment, government, and higher education. Elevate Aviation Group’s wholly owned subsidiaries, Private Jet Services, Elevate Jet, and Elevate MRO, share a mission to provide aircraft owners and flyers unsurpassed service, safety, and counsel. Whether clients require charter flights, large group travel, aircraft management services, aircraft maintenance or aircraft acquisition services, Elevate Aviation Group delivers highly personalized solutions to meet each client’s unique needs 24 hours a day, 365 days of the year to any destination.

title: Talent Advisor / Senior Talent Advisor
description:
**Talent Advisor / Senior Talent Advisor**  

Location: Remote with Travel (20% travel)  

Type: Full Time
Salary: $45,000-$62,000 + Uncapped Monthly Bonus Incentives
  

**Min. Qualifications:** 2 years of direct recruitment experience, managing 30-35 positions at one time and exhibiting a strong knowledge base in sourcing methodologies and tools. This also includes screening, and partnering with hiring managers to effectively meet the staffing needs of the organization.  


**Why Talent Advisors Choose ABC:**
* **Structured Career & Compensation Growth**: Clear pathways from Talent Advisor-Sr Talent Advisor-Executive Recruiter/Recruiting Supervisor- Manager of Recruitment-Sr. Manager of Recruitment-Director-Sr. Director- VP
* **Industry Leading Professional Development**I: Learning is one of our core values! It's instilled in our culture through our initial training cohort, Learning in Action series, and Annual Leadership Summit.
* **Benefits that Nurture the Mind, Body & Soul**: Student Loan Repayment, Maternity/Paternity Award of up to $3,000, FSA for childcare, Short Term Disability options, Restore Program, Calm/First Stop Health/DoorDash subscriptions, Team Happy Hours


**Additional Rewards:**



* Student Loan Repayment Employer Contributions.
* Heath insurance coverage + Health Savings Accounts for tax free benefits on child care + medical expenses.
* 401K Retirement Plans with company matching.
* Personalized Career Progression plans with readiness to next role.
* Up to 25 paid days off per year
* Tuition discounts at our university partnerships.


**ABC Story**


**Our story began in 2017 in Austin, TX. We started with humble roots but big aspirations.**


**From 1 center in North Austin, our movement has inspired thousands of clinicians and operators. Today, the ABC community is 5000+ strong serving thousands of children with ASD.**


**Growth with intentionality: We have a maniac focus on our core values. Each center is purpose-built, each community of teammates is nurtured.**

  


**The Job**
  

The ABC talent team is on a mission to discover and hire the best human beings to grow with us. As we continue to invest in people, we are hiring a Sr. Talent Advisor to help us expand our footprint across the country and ensure as many children have access to ABA services that need them. As a Sr. Talent Advisor, you will play an integral role in hiring our most sought after talent (clinical and non-clinical) across ABC.

  

**What You'll Do**
* Manage the entire attraction process from identifying qualified talent to crafting the most competitive offer
* Provide thought partnership to shape and best match the needs of ABC and the talent in the market.
* Foster trust-based relationships with candidates, gaining a close understanding of their requirements and concerns.
* Identify and attract qualified clinical talent (ex: BCBAs, RBTs, etc.)
* Analyze effectiveness of efforts through search progress reports, status updates, and market trend/feedback presentations to senior leadership.

**What We Look For**
* 2+ years of intensive recruiting experience
* Experience partnering with executives and hiring managers throughout the recruiting cycle.
* Experience solving complex problems, designing creative strategies, and delivering impact as a talent leader.
* Fun, go-getter personality that is driven to hit goals and has the grit to get the job done

  

**See what others have said when they made the decision to grow with us!**

**LinkedIn**

title: Mortgage Recruiter
description:
**Company Overview**


We are looking for ambitious and driven individuals to grow with us. We operate in a fast-paced, dynamic environment where everyone on the team strives to be the "best of the best".


Inspired by hometown values and committed to being responsible and caring for each other, we exist for the benefit of our customers.


Mutual of Omaha Mortgage is a full service lending division offering a complete line of residential Forward and Reverse mortgages. We employ a knowledgeable staff of experienced Mortgage Bankers with an operations team that is second to none!

**The Work:**


We are seeking an individual who is detail oriented and willing to join a fast pace, time sensitive and constantly changing environment.


This position will be in charge of high level sales recruitment, recruiting for technical roles (Salesforce, System Administrator position etc.) and Corporate Administrative roles. You will collaborate closely with hiring managers to understand their staffing needs and develop effective recruiting strategies to attract top-tier candidates. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of the mortgage industry, excellent communication skills, and a proven track record in recruitment.  

  

Compensation will consist of a base pay (60-80K) + bonus per hire depending on source and role.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with hiring managers to understand staffing needs and develop comprehensive recruitment plans.
* Source and attract top talent through various channels, including job boards, social media, networking events, and referrals.
* Screen resumes, conduct interviews, and evaluate candidates to assess their qualifications, skills, and fit for the organization.
* Manage the entire recruitment process from initial contact to offer acceptance, ensuring a positive candidate experience throughout.
* Build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for current and future hiring needs.
* Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices in recruitment and talent acquisition.
* Utilize recruitment metrics and analytics to measure the effectiveness of recruiting strategies and make data-driven decisions.

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in recruitment, preferably in the mortgage or financial services industry.
* Strong understanding of the mortgage lending process and terminology.
* Proven track record of successfully recruiting and hiring top talent.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and establish relationships with candidates and hiring managers.
* Highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Proficiency in applicant tracking systems and other recruitment tools/software.


We are highly respected in our industry and are growing our office with long term employees who are striving for a career.
