title: Onboarding Specialist (Hospital Onboarding Experience Required)
description:
**Elevate Patient Financial Solutions** has an exciting career opportunity available as a/an Onboarding Specialist. This position will be a remote based role. The Full Time schedule for this role will be **Monday through Friday 8 AM to 5 PM.**  

  

**Job Summary**
The Onboarding Specialist will be the administrative expert and provide front-line support to recruiters, hiring managers, employees, and applicants for any process related issues. The Onboarding Specialist will work in collaboration with Recruiters and Leadership to support various aspects of Talent Acquisition, such as overseeing pre-employment background checks, occupational health requirements and reviewing new hire paperwork. The primary function of this role will be responsible for ensuring new hires are in compliance with client occupational health requirements and company new hire expectations. Success in this position requires exceptional communication skills throughout each step of the process.
  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**
* Coordinates onboarding process such as background checks and occupational health requirements.
* Ensure timely completion of new hire pre-employment, to include background checks, secondary checks, health screenings and other requirements needed.
* Accurately creates and manages new employee personnel files.
* Responsible for requesting and ensuring new hire paperwork is completed and filed appropriately in the employee folder.
* Responsible for data entry of new hires in HR system.
* Serves as a dependable point of contact for candidates and hiring managers for candidate status.
* Available by phone and email to provide assistance as needed.
* Builds and fosters relationships with Recruiters, Hiring Managers, employees, applicants, and client contacts to ensure a positive onboarding experience.
* Provide general administrative support to Talent Acquisition team.
* Assists with special projects as needed.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications and Requirements**
To perform this job successfully, an individual must perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or abilities.
* High School Diploma or GED
* 3+ years related experience in new hire onboarding processes
* 2+ years related experience with occupational health related onboarding
* Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook
* Previous applicant tracking system experience is preferred.
* Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality and professionalism under any situation is critical.
* Effective problem-solving skills.
* Proven ability to follow through in an organized and effective way
* Ability to effectively communicate with all parties inside and outside of the organization.
* Detail oriented and highly organized with proven superior time management skills
* Proactive team player with strong work ethic.
* Remote and Hybrid positions require a home internet connection that meets the company’s upload and download speed criteria.

**Benefits:**  

ElevatePFS believes in making a positive impact not only within our industry but also with our employees –the organization’s greatest asset! We take pride in offering comprehensive benefits in a vast array of plans that contribute to the present and future well-being of our employees and their families.
* Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance
* 401K (100% match for the first 3% & 50% match for the next 2%)
* 15 days of PTO
* 7 paid Holidays
* 2 Floating holidays
* 1 Elevate Day (floating holiday)
* Pet Insurance
* Employee referral bonus program
* Teamwork: We believe in teamwork and having fun together
* Career Growth: Gain great experience to promote to higher roles

The salary of the finalist selected for this role will be set based on a variety of factors, including but not limited to, internal equity, experience, education, location, specialty and training. This pay scale is not a promise of a particular wage.
The job description does not constitute an employment agreement between the employer and Employee and is subject to change by the employer as the needs of the employer and requirements of the job change.  

  

**ElevatePFS is an Equal Opportunity Employer**

title: Recruiter (Remote)
description:
**About ABC Legal Services:**



ABC Legal Service is proud to be the national leader in filing service of legal documents. We are growing and are looking for talented new team members to support our growth and solve exciting challenges!



We are a team of 350 with offices in Los Angeles, Dallas, Miami, Brooklyn, Chicago, Washington DC, and more. Seattle is our home and headquarters. We've been successful in this unique business for over 30 years and we continue to advance our technology and business processes to remain years ahead of what our competition is able to offer


**Job Overview:**



The Recruiter will recruit candidates who are currently active legal process servers or who are interested in gig work and becoming a legal process server. The recruiter will work with the sourcing team conducting high volume outreach to candidates explaining the roles & responsibilities of the job. Continuous recruiting and outreach throughout the US includes working with the sourcing team and executing strategies based on market trends.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Generate leads by conducting high-volume outreach activities (cold calling, SMS, email campaigns)
* Execute creative sourcing strategies to connect with high-quality candidates
* Keep hiring managers updated on strategy, hires and pipelines


**Qualifications:**


* 3+ years recruiting in a high-volume environment
* Experience creatively recruiting candidates in a high-volume, metric-driven environment
* Proficient in formatting excel spreadsheets using data tools & formulas
* Experience creating & maintaining pipelines and talent pools in a CRM or ATS
* Experience creating e-marketing campaigns
* Detail oriented, self-motivated and have the ability to focus on complex tasks in a fast-paced environment


**We know that a company's success starts with its employees. We also know that an individual's success starts with the right career opportunity. Join our team today!**


* Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage
* Retirement plan with 5% matching
* 10 paid holidays per year
* Referral program
* Work from home

title: IT Recruiting Specialist
description:
**Job Title**: IT Recruiting Specialist
**Location:** Remote**Term:** Full Time

Centuria Corporation is seeking a IT Recruiting Specialist to support our Service Delivery team.
Centuria, a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB), has been delivering IT, Engineering, and Scientific solutions to the Federal Government since 2002. During our two decades of service, we have earned the trust and respect of our government clients for the simple reason that we have great people who are experts in their fields and take pride and ownership in everything they do. **Job Responsibilities:*** Utilize sourcing methods for recruiting and attracting cleared candidates for entry, mid, and senior level positions across the country.
* Create Job Postings/ ads across multiple online platforms.
* Act as a first line ambassador to potential candidates by filtering, screening, interviewing, and actively networking with talent in the job market.
* Track candidate progress and maintain contact with candidates via the Lever Application Tracking System (ATS)
* Coordinate and schedule interviews between candidates and Hiring Managers.
* Provide detailed breakdowns of candidate findings for hard to fill roles.
* Respond to and qualify employee referrals for open opportunities.
* Negotiate pay rates and fill positions in accordance with company goals and expectations.
* Maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates that fit the criteria of various programs.


**Job Requirements:*** B.A./B.S. and 5+ years of recruiting experience.
* Experience working within the government contracting recruiting space.
* Extensive experience in all aspects of the recruiting lifecycle
* Basic knowledge and understanding of IT technologies/ concepts.
* Experience performing Boolean searches and a multitude of deep Web sourcing techniques, to identify talent.
* Experience using various job boards (Indeed, Clearance Jobs, etc.)
* High proficiency with full Microsoft Office Suite, with emphasis on advanced Excel skills
* Self-starter able to work independently or as part of a team.
* Strong organizational and time management skills
* Excellent analysis and communication skills

title: Recruiter
description:
Blue Ridge Power is a full-service EPC (Engineering, Procurement, Construction) company for solar projects across the United States, offering integrated engineering, a qualified professional labor force, and an expansive fleet of equipment to serve the needs of our clients. Headquartered in Asheville, NC, with offices in Fayetteville, NC, and Lexington, SC. Blue Ridge Power has installed 8 GW of solar infrastructure throughout the country and employs about 700 team members. Learn more at blueridgepower.com.



Blue Ridge Power (BRP) is seeking a **Recruiter** to join our Talent Acquisition team! The Recruiter will lead and manage the full life cycle of recruiting activities. They will train and mentor hiring managers, maintain a robust candidate pipeline through existing and new industry relationships, as well as develop and execute strategic recruiting efforts. We are proudly independently owned, giving us the flexibility to move quickly in our mission to become the best solar EPC company in the country and one that attracts the brightest talent.



The Recruiter will report directly to the Talent Acquisition Manager. *This position can be remote but the individual must be able to work Eastern Standard Time.*


**What You'll Do:**


* Develop and execute sourcing strategies to recruit candidates interested in Blue Ridge Power and the solar industry.
* Coach and guide hiring managers through the full life cycle recruiting process.
* Manage the full life cycle of recruitment, from sourcing and screening to offer process, negotiation and closing.
* Research candidate pool and recognize all sourcing possibilities, while identifying barriers and solutions to the recruiting process.
* Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced, high-volume environment with constantly changing priorities.
* Review resumes for appropriateness of skills, experience, and knowledge in relation to position requirements.
* Partner with hiring managers and other decision makers, participating in the candidate selection process.
* Create and maintain positive relationships with both active and passive candidates.
* Maintaining an understanding of the market data and creatively identifying top talent.
* Utilizes Greenhouse (ATS) to maintain accurate and up-to-date recruitment activities and candidate files.
* Create and modify job descriptions to attract talent.
* Represent and promote the company's culture and core values throughout the recruitment process.


**Must-Haves:**


* 3-5+ years of full cycle recruiting experience in the engineering and construction industry.
* Experience with Greenhouse, or similar ATS.
* Proven ability to support multiple business functions.
* Experience with standard applicant tracking systems required.
* Demonstrated ability to recruit diverse individuals.
* Ability to negotiate and consult on compensation packages.
* Experience partnering with Hiring Manager to collaborate on open requisitions and to fill openings on target dates.
* Ability to work successfully in an environment with high visibility and the ability to manage complex and sensitive situations independently.
* Track record of flawless execution and a strong ability to multi-task in a fast paced, deadline-oriented, high-demand environment with tight deliverables.
* Experienced in sourcing passive talent.
* Knowledge of diverse pipelines and sourcing, and best practices for inclusive recruiting.
* Be an exceptional communicator in both written and verbal interactions; clear, concise, and courageous in giving tough but supportive feedback when needed.
* Ability to work independently and be a strong team player.


**Nice-to-Haves:**


* Bachelors degree in relevant field is preferred.
* Renewable energy or solar experience.
* LinkedIn Recruiter experience.
* Indeed Resume experience.


**Working Environment and Physical Demand:**


* Remote or Asheville, North Carolina.
* Preferred location is NC; for a remote position, some travel required, 10-15%.
* Must be able to work East Coast Hours, 8 AM - 5 PM EST, Monday-Friday.

  

Blue Ridge Power believes in taking care of our employees by offering benefits that support their physical, mental, and financial well-being.



Our comprehensive benefits package includes Medical, Dental, Vision, Matching 401k, Paid Time Off, Company Paid Holidays, Training and Development, Tuition Reimbursement, Hybrid Work Options, Remote Work Options, Dog-Friendly Offices, and much more!



Blue Ridge Power supports organizations local to our offices in Fayetteville, NC, and Asheville, NC, including the school systems, environmental groups, athletics, youth organizations, and more.



Blue Ridge Power is committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging in the workplace.

  


*Blue Ridge Power does not accept any unsolicited resumes or referrals from any third-party recruiting firms or agencies.*

title: GTM / Corporate Recruiter
description:
Overview:
**WHO WE ARE**
Xactly is a leader in Intelligent Revenue Solutions and a part of Vista Equity Partners portfolio companies since 2017. The Xactly Intelligent Revenue Platform marries artificial intelligence and 17 years of proprietary data in easy-to-use applications.  

Named among the best workplaces in the U.S. by Great Place to Work six times, honored on FORTUNE Magazine’s inaugural list of the 100 Best Workplaces for Millennials, and chosen as the “Market Leader in Incentive Compensation” by CRM magazine. We’re building a culture of success and are looking for motivated professionals to join us! **THE OPPORTUNITY**
Join our dynamic HR team as a full-cycle Recruiter focusing on strengthening our Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Product, and G&A teams. Make an immediate impact by actively sourcing and qualifying candidates, driving hiring strategies, and ensuring an outstanding candidate experience. Ideal candidates have a strong understanding of the technology industry and take a talent partnership approach.  

We are looking for a recruiter that is located in Denver, CO or San Jose, CA area. We are also considering candidates who are remote.  

**THE TEAM**
At Xactly, we believe everyone has a unique story to tell, and these small differences between us have a big impact. When bright, diverse minds come together, we’re challenged to think different ways, generate creative ideas, be more innovative, and take on new perspectives. Our customers come from different cultures and walks of life all around the world, and we believe our teams should reflect that to build strong and lasting relationships.  

Xactly’s Human Resources team is a global, diverse team, representing a range of experiences. To be successful in this role, we’ll look to you to serve as a business partner and talent advisor to key leadership managers across Xactly’s global teams including North America, EMEA, and APAC. **THE SKILLSET*** 8+ years of full-cycle recruiting experience
* Sales and GTM recruitment experience a must and preferably in tech environments
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
* Expertise in building partnerships and with hiring managers - and being a talent coach/advisor who is unafraid to challenge the status quo at times
* Experience using/managing ATS workflows and vigilant about keeping a clean database
* Data driven, proficient in recruitment metrics and tools
* Collaborative and communicative with stakeholders at all levels
* Self-sufficient and motivated to excel in a fast-paced environment
* Results-driven with a track record of success in managing both the candidate experience and manager experience.
* Optimistic and resourceful problem solver

 **RESPONSIBILITIES*** Lead full-cycle recruitment for mostly GTM and some Product, and G&A departments
* Partner with hiring managers to understand and prioritize what are the talent profile needs, convey market/talent landscape, and set up sourcing and interview plans
* Employ innovative recruitment strategies to attract diverse talent
* Advise hiring managers on best practices and tools
* Ensure an exceptional candidate experience through effective communication and follow-up
* Achieve staffing goals within desired timeframes
* Lead candidate experience across various departments
* Build talent pipelines and articulate company value proposition
* Maintain ATS database hygiene and provide regular pipeline updates
* Improve recruitment processes and candidate experience
* Cultivate strong relationships with hiring managers
* Maintain healthy talent pipelines and provide insights through reporting

 **BENEFITS AND PERKS*** Comprehensive insurance coverage (including pet insurance!)
* Flexible time off and sick days
* Short-term disability, long-term disability, maternity and parental leave
* Gym/fitness reimbursement and tuition reimbursement
* Flexible savings account & Health savings account
* Paid holidays and up to 3 days paid community and volunteer leave
* Life and AD&D insurance.
* 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan
* Access to wellness program (Grokker, EAP, quarterly wellness webinars)
* Employee discount program
* Additional voluntary benefits such as pet insurance, critical illness, accident insurance, hospital indemnity, and legal plan

  

*The compensation range is specific to the posted job location and role and takes into account the wide range of factors considered in making compensation decisions but not limited to skill sets, experience, training, licensure, certifications, performance, and market and peer comparisons. Salary ranges allow for growth opportunities as the employee develops new skills and/or hones current skills. A reasonable range estimate is $108,000-$136,000 plus applicable bonus.* ***Applications will be accepted only for those currently residing in the posted country for this role. There is no expectation of approval for an international relocation for this job.*****(Include this line, if the job is available for the posted country only and relocations from another country is not considered otherwise remove it from the job description)** **OUR VISION:** Unleashing human potential to maximize company performance. We address a critical business need: to incentivize employees and align their behaviors with company goals. **OUR CORE VALUES:** Customer Focus | Accountability | Respect | Excellence (CARE) are the keys to our success, and each day we’re committed to upholding them by delivering the best we can to our customers.  

Xactly is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Xactly provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law. This means we believe in celebrating diversity and creating an inclusive workplace environment, where everyone feels valued, heard, and has a sense of belonging. By doing this, everyone in the Xactly family has the power to make a difference and unleash their full potential.  

We do not accept resumes from agencies, headhunters, or other suppliers who have not signed a formal agreement with us.

title: Full Cycle Recruiter
description:
**Joyful Jobs**

**Full-Cycle Recruiter**

**About the Organization:**

Joyful Jobs is seeking a recruiter to join our team! Founded in July 2021, Joyful Jobs provides fast, flexible, affordable talent acquisition services catered to small and medium-sized businesses and nonprofits. We function as an outsourced partner to our clients, who typically only need to make a handful of hires per year and typically don’t have a dedicated HR/recruiting team in place. Our team currently consists of our Founder/CEO and a virtual assistant for marketing/business development, but we plan to continue slowly growing by 1-3 team members per year as we expand our services and client base.

**Position Summary:**

Reporting directly to the Founder/CEO, the Recruiter position is responsible for managing 3-6 job requisitions from start to finish. This includes intake meetings and ongoing communication with clients, posting jobs, actively sourcing candidates, reviewing resumes, and conducting phone screens. The successful candidate will strongly align with our mission and values and be passionate about serving our clients.

**Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Conduct intake meetings with clients when a new job requisition opens
* Post assigned jobs on sites including but not limited to Indeed, LinkedIn, SmartRecruiters ATS, Craigslist, Handshake, ZipRecruiter, and other job boards
* Source and send messages to passive candidates on sites such as Indeed and LinkedIn
* Review all applications for assigned jobs within 2 business days and deactivate or engage candidates as appropriate
* Conduct phone interviews with candidates meeting qualifications for assigned jobs
* Share promising candidates with clients, coordinate next steps as needed, and communicate other relevant updates about the job
* Maintain “short list” of top candidates to engage for future opportunities that arise
* Keep job status documents up-to-date with current information about sourcing strategies completed or in process and candidate interviews
* Work with internal team on collaborative efforts and projects
* Assist Founder/CEO with miscellaneous tasks as needed to support growth of and improvements to the agency (ie, building SOP documents, brainstorming revisions to client onboarding process, etc)
* Utilize software and databases including Microsoft 365 (especially Outlook, Word, Excel, OneDrive, and Teams), Google Drive, Slack, and Trello
* On occasion, attend job fairs or networking events/meetings on behalf of the company
* Other duties as assigned by the Founder/CEO

**Required Qualifications:**

* Must have full-cycle recruiting experience including sourcing, screening, interviewing, scheduling, and coordinating with hiring managers
* Must have experience recruiting white-collar roles such as marketing, operations, finance, accounting, HR, IT, sales, business development, and administrative, at varying seniority levels from coordinator to executive
* SUPERB customer service inclination and skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication, organizational skills, and attention to detail (for real, we will definitely look for this in our selection process!)
* 50+ WPM typing speed and generally tech-savvy
* Some basic knowledge of Microsoft 365 products (minimally, Word and Excel)
* Not afraid to take initiative, but also knows when to ask questions or await direction
* Enjoys thinking creatively to most effectively recruit and screen candidates for unique roles and/or clients with particular culture fit needs
* Passionate about building relationships with candidates, clients, and team members alike
* Able to think objectively, holistically, and without bias to discern the good candidates from the great ones
* Always happy to pick up the phone when necessary, but knows how to effectively combine verbal and written communication depending on the situation
* Friendly and easy to talk to while remaining professional
* Commitment to contribute towards a respectful and inclusive culture where differences are appreciated; the ability to work with all individuals regardless of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, sexual identity, age, religion, marital/family status, disability, national origin and military status

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Strongly preferred: recruitment experience for an agency, small-to-medium-sized business, or nonprofit
* Business degree
* Located in Tucson, AZ

We know there are great candidates who will not fit everything we have described above or who have important skills we have not considered. If that’s you, do not hesitate to apply and tell us about yourself. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by an employee assigned to this job. This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel incumbent in this position.

**Why work with us?**

* Get in on the ground floor of a very small but successful startup, with possible opportunities to grow your career as the company expands
* Work for a mission-driven Founder/CEO who is passionate about making the world a better place, including dedicated support of your career goals
* Flexible work hours (mostly remote) with a culture that prioritizes work/life balance and mental health

**Position Location:** Ideal candidate is based in Tucson, AZ - work will be primarily conducted remotely, but prefer ability to attend occasional in-person meetings with team and clients

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $16.00 - $20.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 25 per week

Experience level:

* 10 years
* 11+ years
* 2 years
* 3 years
* 4 years
* 5 years
* 6 years
* 7 years
* 8 years
* 9 years

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Choose your own hours
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* No nights
* No weekends

Experience:

* nonprofit recruiting: 1 year (Preferred)
* Recruiting: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist
description:
**About Us:** Prometric is a leading provider of technology-enabled testing and assessment solutions to many of the world’s most recognized licensing and certification organizations, academic institutions, and government agencies. We support more than 7 million test takers annually at our testing locations in 180 countries around the world. With over three decades of experience working with clients of all sizes across a multitude of industry sectors, our mission is to design and deliver the highest quality and most innovative testing solutions anytime, anywhere.
  
  

The Talent Acquisition Specialist at Prometric will own the talent acquisition process and overall strategy for the US Test Centers and Nurse Aide Recruitment. This position requires expert organizational skills, a go-getter mentality, and the ability to multitask in a high-volume recruiting environment. This position requires a true "sourcer" who can quickly find qualified candidates to fill these important roles. The ability to "think outside the box" to find cost-effective ways to attract candidates is an absolute must. You will be responsible for the full recruitment life cycle, from creative job marketing, sourcing, interviewing and job offers. The individual will be proactive in ensuring that Prometric is in a position to have a robust pipeline of talented individuals.
  
  

Prometric is a trusted test development and delivery provider to more than 300 organizations worldwide. On their behalf, we securely deliver an average of 7 million exams per year to people who are seeking to improve their lives. Whether by starting a new career, further developing their skills to improve on an existing one, adding to their qualifications for a promotion, taking school entrance exams or simply for professional development, people taking tests want a reliable, convenient and hassle-free experience. Prometric serves as an industry gatekeeper, ensuring that people legitimately earn the credentials they seek to achieve, and thereby guaranteeing a fair testing experience for all who come through our doors.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Lead end to end recruitment for Test Center and Nurse Aide positions.
* Conduct phone, virtual and/or in-person interviews and maintain a complete record of interviews and new hires
* Reporting on and tracking key recruiting metrics
* Timely dispositioning of candidates and requisitions
* Define and use internet recruitment strategies, innovative social media, and non-traditional sources for attracting talent including but not limited to: job board sourcing, virtual hiring events, social media recruiting platform usage, etc.
* Drive strategy and framework for talent acquisition for Test Centers.
* Establish, track and iterate measurements focusing on the effectiveness of the Talent Acquisition function; such as time to fill and cost per hire
* Act as a strategic partner to all functional leaders assisting with hiring plans, resource allocation and communications/advertising to decrease time to fill
* Assist in diversity and college recruitment strategy
* Partner with outside agencies when required
* Other projects as assigned


**Experience:**  

* Bachelor degree preferred or relevant experience
* 3+ years of high volume recruitment experience
* Strong customer service, communication (both written and verbal) and interpersonal and organization skills
* An ability to juggle multiple projects and priorities, meet deadlines and maintain professionalism under pressure.
* Willingness and ability to be both hands on with all levels of the organization as well as serve as a strategic partner to hiring managers


Prometric is an Equal Employment/Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate in hiring based on sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, and local law.

title: HRIS Benefits & Onboarding Analyst
description:
**Essential Duties and Responsibilities****:**

* Analyst must be able to read and interpret summary plan descriptions for Employee Benefit Plans (Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, AD&D, and Ancillary Benefit Plans)
* Analyst will manage the New Hire Open Enrollment, Life Event, and Annual Open portal for clients in the iSolved platform
* Analyst will work with new Human Capital Management (HCM) clients to setup their Benefits selection experience within the iSolved platform
* Analyst will plan and maintain a monthly calendar of clients who will have Annual Open Enrollments within 60-days to ensure that Benefit plan information is updated in advance of Annual Open Enrollment
* Analyst will collaborate closely with the HRC team to streamline processes and procedures to ensure smooth transition for clients / employees.
* Analyst will program workflows that will notify clients of completed enrollments
* Analyst will train clients on AOE, NHOE, and Life Event approvals
* Analyst will work with 3rd party integration systems to automate data feeds from iSolved to insurance carriers
* Analyst will work with clients to help them complete a New Hire Onboarding survey that will assist Solex in building a New Hire Onboarding Experience (NHOE)
* Analyst will configure the NHOE feature in accordance with the client's wishes
* Analyst will train the client to initiate the NHOE and teach them how to complete the New Hire wizard
* Analyst is expected to work eight (8) hours per day and depending upon busy season, until such time that their work is completed for their clients
* Analyst must enjoy working in a data management role with limited direct client responsibilities
 **Qualifications**

**Preference will be given to candidates who have the following:**

* Knowledge of Benefits is required with preference given to Benefits advisor experience
* Experience with computer basics including proficiency in Microsoft office products
* Superior customer service skills, strong analytical skills, excellent organizational skills, and a keen attention to detail is a must
* Knowledge of iSolved HCM Platform is a plus
* Ability to analyze data with particular attention to detail
* Attention to detail is and organizational skills will be instrumental in maintaining accurate records and ensuring compliance with benefit regulations.
* Demonstrated experience/maturity to handle confidential and sensitive information.
* Excellent written, oral, and presentation communication skills
* Strong customer service orientation and problem resolution skills
* Excellent interpersonal skills
* Analyst will have 3 to 5, or more, years of professional experience
 **Physical Requirements:**

  

* Must be able to talk, listen and speak clearly on telephone
* Normal working conditions require normal to close concentration, visual attention and manual dexterity. Lifting requirements less than 10 pounds. Moderate noise.

 **Equal Employment Opportunity**

Solex HCM (& Affiliates) provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.


This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: Recruiting Coordinator
description:
**Custard Insurance Adjusters, Inc.**

Recruiting Coordinator

We are growing our company and looking for highly skilled team members to grow with us! We are looking for motivated individuals who are passionate about quality work and providing superior customer service.

**Job purpose**

The Recruiting Coordinator, under the supervision of the Property division, provides administrative support to the recruitment department.

**Duties and responsibilities**

The candidate needs to have a minimum of 1 year of experience in a similar field. The job responsibilities include creating and maintaining employee files, reaching out new potential 1099 and Catastrophe adjusters who have submitted their resumes, receiving inbound calls from adjusters candidates and staff, providing administrative support to the office team, and conducting clerical duties.

**Recruiting Coordinator Responsibilities and Duties:**

· Screen and interview new 1099 and Catastrophe adjuster prospects to include reviewing resumes, licenses, certifications, training, and experience.

· Build relationships with candidates and ensure that candidate profile databases are up-to-date and accurately reflect skillsets.

· Work with recruiting team to communicate adjusters considered eligible for field and contract assignments based on their initial contact and screening.

· Assist with continuous updating of 1099 status based on compliance and contacts.

· Assist with email contact campaigns for onboarded adjusters on a regular basis.

· Manage department inbox.

· Prepare manage and store paperwork for in regards to policies and procedures.

· Maintain schedule and coordinate calendar activities if needed.

· Support with special projects and additional tasks as assigned within the recruitment department.

**Skills and Qualifications:**

· Bachelor degree or relatable job experience.

· Basic understanding of adjustment and insurance terminology a plus.

· Able to use various computer software.

· Punctual, reliable and must have strong communication skill.

· Strong verbal and oral communication skills.

· Self-motivated and strong analytical skills.

· Attention to detail, prioritization skill and time management.

· Maintain a strong relationship with key groups.

· Motivational and communication skill.

· Act as a reliable and supportive team member.

· Able to complete a complex administrative task with less supervision.

As with all positions, this function will be performed by a qualified person. No form of improper discrimination will be used as a job qualification.

For more information about Custard Insurance Adjusters please visit our website at www.custard.com

title: Dental Staff Recruiter
description:
Why Choose Sage:
**Seeking a fun and hard-working individual to add to our Talent Acquisition Team! This position is 100% remote!**  

Sage Dental is growing and so is our Talent Acquisition team! Sage has 90+ offices in Florida and Georgia and as part of our growth, we are looking for dynamic and talented professionals to join our team. The Dental Team Recruiter is responsible for recruitment tasks for staff positions (OM, AOM, DA, etc.) in specific regions of Sage Dental offices in Florida and Georgia. The successful candidate will have solid experience in dental recruitment (ideally Staff positions) with a customer service attitude and be willing to travel up to 5-10% of the time.  

Responsibilities:
* Operates as a Strategic Talent Advisor, partnering with the business to drive all aspects of the full-cycle recruitment process.
* Partners with Hiring Managers to develop and understand position requirements and demonstrates a strong understanding of the talent landscape, analytics, and sourcing strategies.
* Ensures a high level of candidate engagement and positive candidate experience.
* Drives and influences the candidate assessment and selection process with the broader hiring team.
* Extends job offers and negotiates terms.
* Maintains a strong pipeline of qualified candidates and cultivates a strong network of passive talent.
* Anticipates and proactively communicates recruiting activity and status to Hiring Managers and Business Partners.
* Leverage technology and tools to maximize candidate quality and personal productivity.
* Influences and improves recruiting processes and metrics.
* Partners closely with broader TA team to ensure consistent application of recruiting processes and practices.


Qualifications:
* A minimum of 1 year experience in Dental Recruiting or Talent Acquisition, DSO (Dental Support Organization) experience.
* Bachelor's degree preferred.
* Must have personal integrity and accept accountability for actions and decisions.
* Must possess strong attention to detail and the ability to successfully problem solve.
* Possess strong communication and negotiating skills.

Exhibit strong time management and organizational skills.  
* 

Must be able to travel up to 10% to attend dental conferences, career fairs, etc.

title: Care Coordinator/Recruiter

Our clients are very important to us and we need a talented individual that is compassionate, detail oriented, able to assess the caregivers on staff, be able to review care plans and motivate our staff to provide the highest level of quality care to the clients that we service.**

title: Talent Acquisition Manager
description:
**Prior experience in talent acquisition leadership capacity in ABA field is required for this role** 

Mindcolor Autism was founded in 2019 with the goal of providing compassionate, individualized Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy to families impacted by autism. We are a mission driven company and pride ourselves on having a unique culture centered around strong ethics, teamwork and transparency. By closely working together with team members and families, we can achieve the best outcomes.

We are looking for a Talent Acquisition Manager to join our growing team! This role is an opportunity to be an integral part in leading our talent acquisition strategy and ensuring we have the right talent in place to support the success of our team members and clients!

**Job Description:**

* Develop and maintain talent acquisition strategies that align with the business’ needs and attract a diverse pool of high caliber talent
* Regularly review existing recruiting systems / processes and identify areas for improvement
* Establish and maintain relationships with hiring managers to stay abreast of current and future hiring needs. Work with hiring managers to leverage hiring best practices and facilitate a competency based candidate review and selection process
* Oversee the process of creating job descriptions and advertising openings using various outlets including recruiting websites, social networks, and community job boards
* Perform searches for qualified candidates according to relevant job criteria using computer databases, networking, internet recruiting resources, cold calls, and team member referrals
* Recruit and perform talent acquisition activities such as resume reviews & phone screens, conducting & arranging candidate interviews and providing recommendations on the selection of applicants to hiring managers
* Utilize online and offline resources to increase our pipeline of qualified Registered Behavior Technicians (BTs and RBTs) and Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs) candidates
* Review, analyze and deliver appropriate reports, metrics and updates to business leaders on recruitment initiatives, including metrics on DEI and hiring results.
* Oversee the talent acquisition team, to include the overall daily workflow of the department
* Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and company policies

**Job Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree
* 5+ years recruitment experience, preferably in ABA therapy or healthcare
* 2+ year of management experience, including development of processes and recruitment initiatives
* Exceptional relationship management and interpersonal skills
* Proven direct sourcing experience, including excellent research skills that result in the creation of unique talent pools of qualified candidates
* Demonstrated ability to create, execute and measure multiple sourcing strategies
* Strong external network of recruitment contacts to leverage best practices a plus
* Ability to think strategically, independently and creatively, and take ownership of critical issues.
* Excellent project management and organizational skills with a strong attention to detail. Proven ability to manage time, priorities and projects
* Proficiency with the MS Office / Google G-suite including in-depth knowledge of Word and Excel with the ability to pick up new systems and software easily
* Experience developing a system to track and engage with candidates with or without an ATS

**Salary/ Benefits/ Additional Information:**

* $80,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year
* Medical/Dental/Vision
* Life Insurance
* PTO accrued on a bi-weekly basis
* Health and Wellness flex days
* Company paid holidays
* 401(k) with company contribution
* IT reimbursement
* Paid parental leave
* Working Advantage Employee Discounts

Pay: $80,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* Monday to Friday

title: Talent Acquisition Partner
description:
**Now Hiring! Talent Acquisition Partner**
------------------------------------------

  

Research Triangle Park, NC (Remote)


Pay Range: $83,200 - $114,000

 **The world needs creative solutions. We need YOU!**

 **Where the chemistry happens…**


As a Talent Acquisition Partner, you will be responsible for consultative recruitment of outstanding talent. You will partner with site leadership and hiring managers to understand their business and talent needs in order to ensure the highest quality candidates are presented in the most time effective manner. You will collaborate across sourcing, candidate care and diversity strategy, leveraging critical thinking and influencing skills to resolve complex and challenging situations.

**As a Talent Acquisition Partner, You Create Chemistry By...**
---------------------------------------------------------------

* Developing and executing a staffing strategy for assigned businesses focused on creative sourcing methods to identify high-potential, diverse talent.
* Proactively identifing and developing solutions to talent pipeline challenges and partner with talent attraction, candidate care, and diversity strategy resources as needed.
* Being responsible for building and implementing creative sourcing partnerships with external solution providers.
* Being responsible for leading regional strategic projects to provide sustainable Talent Acquisition solutions.
* Anticipating changing needs of hiring managers and the businesses he/she supports and adjusts strategy accordingly.
* Being adept at building and maintaining a strong internal network with key stakeholders.
* Effectively balancing process excellence and strategic effectiveness.
* Being accountable for performance targets (i.e. conversion ratio, recruiting effectiveness, hiring manager and candidate satisfaction).
* Enabling optimization of hiring decisions in the context of the broader talent strategy.
* Challenging and educating hiring managers on talent assessment, business/talent risks of hiring certain candidates, and talent assumptions.
**If you have...**
------------------

* Comprehensive behavioral based interviewing and candidate assessment skills.
* Demonstrated experience building relationships, consulting and influencing hiring managers in regard to candidate sourcing and selection, market demographics, and broadening search parameters to improve quality of talent pool.
* Experience developing and executing recruitment strategies in varied regional markets, preferably in a high volume, fast paced environment, with ownership over the candidate and hiring manager experience.
* Knowledge of current networking and sourcing trends including extensive use of LinkedIn and social media channels.
* Current knowledge of state and federal employment/labor laws and practices.
**Then...**
-----------

 **Click below to Belong@BASF!**

 **Create Your Own Chemistry when taking advantage of our Total Rewards.**


At BASF you get more than just compensation, Medical & Dental. Our total offer includes a wide range of elements you need to be your best in every stage of your life. That’s what we call you@BASF. Our Periodic Table of Benefits includes some additional perks below for starters…

* Flexible Work Arrangements whenever possible

* Maternity/Paternity Leave, Infertility & Adoption reimbursement
* Mentoring & Development Programs
* Employee Discounts
* Pet insurance
* Matching Donations to your favorite cause

**Privacy Statement**
---------------------

  

BASF takes security & data privacy very seriously. We will never request financial information of any kind via email, private text message or direct message on any social medial platform or job board. Furthermore, we will never send a candidate a check for equipment or request any type of payment during the job application process. If you have experienced any of the above, please contact myhr@basf.com to report fraud.

**Pay Transparency**
--------------------

  

BASF is committed to pay transparency practices. The competitive Pay Range for this role is $83,200 - $114,000. Actual pay will be determined based on education, certifications, experience, and other job-related factors permitted by law.

**Equal Employment Opportunities**
----------------------------------

  

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, disability status, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

  

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.

title: Remote Construction Recruiter
description:
### **Seeking Recruiting Professionals to Join Exciting Startup Opportunity!**

 **Job Title:** Remote Recruiter **Location:** Fully Remote **Pay**: $20-$23 per hour **Job Description:**
The Contractor Consultants is seeking a highly motivated and organized Hiring Specialist to join our dynamic team! As a Remote Recruiter, you will play a crucial role in our recruitment process, ensuring that we find top-tier talent to our clients in the Construction Industry! This is a remote position, allowing you to work from the comfort of your own space. **Prior experience recruiting for (or working in) the Construction Industry REQUIRED!**  

  

  

**Responsibilities:*** Screen and evaluate applications and resumes to identify potential candidates who meet the required qualifications and skills for various positions at various companies.
* Conduct initial interviews with candidates to assess their suitability for specific roles, and provide feedback to the hiring team.
* Lead client meetings to ensure company satisfaction with our services.
* Coordinate with clients to schedule and organize final interviews, ensuring a smooth and efficient recruitment process.
* Obtain feedback from clients after final interviews are completed, enabling us to continuously improve our selection process and facilitate onboarding.
* Utilize and maintain various HR software platforms to manage candidate data, interview schedules, and other recruitment-related information.
* Collaborate with the HR team to develop and implement effective recruitment strategies and techniques to attract high-quality candidates.

**Qualifications:*** 1-2 years of recruiting experience.
* Proven experience in recruitment or talent acquisition within the Construction Industry.
* Knowledgeable about construction industry.
* Excellent proficiency in the English language, both written and oral, to effectively communicate with candidates and team members.
* Exceptional organizational skills with the ability to maintain detailed and accurate records throughout the entire recruiting life cycle.
* Strong self-starter with the ability to work independently and take ownership of tasks and responsibilities.
* A team player who can collaborate effectively with colleagues and hiring managers.
* Motivated and passionate about contributing to the growth of a startup company.
* Comfortable working remotely and able to manage time efficiently to meet deadlines.
* Bilingual in English and Spanish is highly preferred

**Pay:**
You will be compensated with a competitive hourly rate ranging from $20 to $23 per hour, commensurate with your qualifications and experience. **Location:**
This is a fully remote position, allowing you to work from any location that best suits your needs. ***Join our team at The Contractor Consultants and be a part of our exciting journey as we build a talented and dedicated workforce across the nation!***

title: Service Member Recruitment Coordinator
description:
**Who We Are:**
---------------



FoodCorps partners with schools and communities to nourish kids’ health, education, and sense of belonging so that every child, in every school, experiences the joy and power of food. Our AmeriCorps members serve alongside educators and school nutrition leaders to provide kids with nourishing meals, food education, and culturally affirming experiences with food that celebrate and nurture the whole child. Building on this direct service, FoodCorps advocates for policy change, grows networks, and develops leaders in service of every kid’s health and wellbeing. Our goal is that by 2030, every child will have access to food education and nourishing food in school!


**What We’re Looking For:**
---------------------------



FoodCorps is seeking a full-time Service Member Recruitment Coordinator to provide critical support to the recruitment efforts of our AmeriCorps service program. Reporting directly to the Senior Manager of Service Member Recruitment, you will support our ongoing efforts to recruit hundreds of diverse and passionate service members who will ultimately commit to a year of paid service helping to connect kids to nourishing food in schools. By contributing your ideas to the annual recruitment strategy, designing and leading online and offline engagement efforts with prospective candidates and state teams, representing FoodCorps at targeted recruitment events, and helping to forge key local and/or regional partnerships in support of building long-term recruitment pipelines, you will help recruit and select our cohort of service members.



This full-time position will have a hiring priority for the NorthEast area, but candidates located elsewhere may apply. Travel may be required, up to 20%.


**Who You Are:**



You are an enthusiastic and strong communicator with a mind for project management. You are a motivated self-starter with an ability to effectively coordinate and follow through on projects. You are a creative problem solver skilled at multitasking, prioritizing, and keeping an eye on the larger goal while juggling multiple responsibilities. Details are your superpower and interest in networking with food, agriculture, public health, justice and education organizations/institutions are where you feel at home. You are comfortable with public speaking and remote supervision. You value giving and receiving feedback. Most importantly, you are committed to centering equity in each aspect of your work and are eager to engage in conversations of how we can ensure an equitable recruitment and selection process.


**How We Work:**



At FoodCorps, we are intentional about how we do our work, and how we show up in the world. We practice being in charge of accessing, feeding, and evolving our worldviews. We connect with our history, own our flaws, evolve our biases, and deepen our understanding of ourselves. We are willing to hold ourselves and others accountable with care through courageous conversations while celebrating diversity, embracing complexity, and building belonging. We recognize that we do not have all of the answers, we create space for divergent perspectives. We are intentional and collaborative about shifting power, access, and resources to those most impacted by systemic oppression.


**Primary Responsibilities:**
-----------------------------


**FoodCorps Service Member Recruitment**


* Partner with the People & Equity Team to implement FoodCorps’ recruitment strategies and goals.
* Serve as the main point of contact for interested and current candidates.
* Communicate the value of serving with FoodCorps to prospective candidates, both one-on-one and to large groups, virtually and in person.
* Represent FoodCorps at recruitment events.
* Support a vibrant engagement program for prospective candidates.
* Help to build and maintain a diverse and qualified pool of candidates.
* Support the Impact Programs department in local/regional recruitment efforts.
* Coordinate with state programs teams to forecast open FoodCorps Member positions.
* Support the application review and selection process, including supervising the pipeline of candidates from application to interview.
* Coordinate and schedule interviews with candidates for the national review team.
* Create a positive service member experience from recruitment and selection through onboarding and the start of service.
* Address last minute changes to the interview schedule.
* Support recruitment data gathering/analysis.
* Analyze recruitment and selection data to find trends that will advise planning for future years.

**Measures of Success:**
------------------------


**By the end of year 1, the Service Member Coordinator will have:**


* 2024- Support FoodCorps Sites in targeted local recruitment to fill unfilled positions by building relationships with supervisors to inform outreach.
* 2024- Support the launch of a candidate experience survey and assist in analyzing data. 2025- Utilize learnings to make shifts to our recruitment and selection processes that will improve the candidate experience.
* Attend at least 10 priority in person recruitment/outreach events before the 2025-2026 application cycle closes.
* Grow the candidate lead list coming from direct recruitment efforts by 15%.

**Thriving at FoodCorps:**
--------------------------



In addition to generous medical benefits and an annual $3000 401(k) matching, FoodCorps provides:


**Time Away:**



Social justice work is both vital and demanding. FoodCorps recognizes this and provides ample time to step away and recharge, including:


* half-day Fridays
* 5 weeks of accrued time off
* 12 federal holidays (AND your birthday!)
* 2-week winter break
* a sabbatical policy

**Family Planning:**
--------------------



As an organization that supports youth development, our family policies need to match our values. To that end, we offer:


* 16 weeks paid parental leave
* Up to $7500 in financial support towards adoption fees, surrogacy expenses, contraceptive services, and travel for abortion services

**Ongoing Support and Professional Development:**
-------------------------------------------------



At FoodCorps, we want our people to work in the way that works best for them. We provide:


* $850 annual home office funds
* Internet bill reimbursement
* Partial cell phone reimbursement
* $500 annual professional development funds

**How to Apply:**
-----------------



Applications will be accepted until a match is made. To be considered, submit your résumé and cover letter through our hiring site at https://foodcorps.org/careers/. Please note that incomplete applications may not be considered.



This position is a coordinator role with a starting salary range between $43,000-$49,575. Note: A cost of living adjustment may be made for candidates living in our designated high cost of living areas. Adjustment would be made after hire and is not reflected in the listed salary range.



People of color, people with disabilities, veterans, and LGBTQ candidates are strongly encouraged to apply. FoodCorps is committed to a diverse workplace, and to supporting our staff with ongoing career development opportunities. FoodCorps is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in its employment decisions. FoodCorps provides reasonable accommodation to applicants and employees as required by law.



Applicants with disabilities may request reasonable accommodation at any point in the employment process.


**Your Safety**
---------------



Legitimate messages from FoodCorps will only come from an email address ending in **@****foodcorps.org**—not any variations of that (e.g. hr@careers-foodcorps.org, morgan@careers-foodcorps.org, etc). Any interested applicants should apply directly to FoodCorps' open positions on https://foodcorps.hiringthing.com/. Additionally FoodCorps will not ask you to submit any information outside of our website prior to hire. The best way to contact us regarding employment opportunities is through our site at https://foodcorps.org/careers/.



If you suspect you’re being targeted as part of a scam we encourage you to submit a fraud report to the Federal Trade Commission with details about your correspondence with the scammer. This helps the FTC better understand the tactics scammers are using and get a sense of the volume of fraud attempts.

title: Recruiter (remote)
description:

Ironclad Environmental Solutions (IES) is a rapidly growing, leader in liquid and wastewater treatment, storage, and disposal solutions.


We are hiring for a **Recruiter**. The ideal candidate has a strong customer-service orientation, is resourceful, and thrives in a fast-paced environment. At IES we have an amazing HR team and would love for you to join our fun and friendly culture.
