title: Recruiting Analytics Operations Manager
description:
Remote, United States
Talent and Recruiting
About Netflix:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.  

About the role:
At Netflix's Talent Acquisition Operations (TA Ops) Enablement team, our mission is to drive operational excellence and value generation by empowering our teams with robust, scalable and innovative infrastructure and solutions.  

We're in search of a dedicated Operations Manager to lead the Operational Data Solutions (ODS) program. ODS is a strategic pillar within Enablement and is dedicated to providing our internal customers with data solutions that enable them to navigate complex operational challenges.  

Given the early stage of ODS, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the program's vision and direction. Your foundational contributions will involve establishing the ODS program infrastructure, including a product development approach, delivery methodologies and performance metrics. As the team is projected to remain streamlined (totaling three members), you’ll also be hands-on, executing requests such as data pulls, report creation, analytics, and more, catering to diverse needs from Talent Acquisition and our Ops teams.  

Beyond delivery, you will be defining and steering the ODS product strategy and overseeing the entire product lifecycle. Your expertise in data and analytics will be key in ensuring that the solutions we develop are not only technically sound but also align with the practical needs of our customers.  

You will champion agile and lean methodologies within our team. This involves promoting a mindset of iterative development, rapid prototyping, and continuous feedback. Your leadership will ensure that the team remains flexible, responsive, and focused on delivering tangible value through user-centered products and services.  

In this role, your expertise in program management and agile product development, coupled with your understanding of operational data and business acumen, will be key in helping us realize the ODS mission and drive operational excellence across our teams.**Lead the strategic and programmatic operations of the ODS team**
------------------------------------------------------------------

* Build the programmatic infrastructure of ODS, including the ODS work system, work intake, product catalog, product development approach, etc.
* Develop Objectives & Key Results (OKRs) and operational metrics (e.g. Key Performance Indicators, Service Level Agreements) ensuring high-impact and efficient operations
* Develop and operationalize data governance-related policies, processes and standards to support our commitment to data quality and integrity
* Act as the primary point of contact for escalated issues within ODS, ensuring effective resolution of high-priority or complex problems
**Manage the end-to-end data solution development lifecycle**
-------------------------------------------------------------

* Lead the end-to-end management of data solution development projects, from initial concept through to deployment and user adoption.
* Lead the team through iterative solution development, focusing on building MVPs to test hypotheses and gather user feedback
* Establish and maintain agile, lean startup and user-centered development processes, ensuring efficient and effective design, development, testing, and implementation of data solutions
* Lead project and development management, including developing schedules, tracking key milestones, solution launch plans and contingencies for high-risk deliverables
**Develop and execute the ODS product strategy**
------------------------------------------------

* Formulate and execute a comprehensive product strategy for ODS data solutions and services
* Develop concise problem statements, success criteria, and Minimally Viable Product Experiments (MVPe), driving for scalable solutions while also delivering value as early as possible
* Manage and coordinate product roadmaps, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives and stakeholder feedback, and achieving measurable progress against OKRs and KPIs
**Who you are:**
----------------

* 3+ years of experience in TA Operations with a focus on data solutions including operational & performance metrics (e.g. time to fill, time to hire, quality of hire, candidate experience, cost per hire, conversion/efficiency/funnel metrics, headcount attainment, etc.) and modeling & forecasting (e.g. hiring demand forecasting, recruiting capacity modeling, interviewer capacity modeling, etc.)
* Product/Solution design methodologies (e.g. Lean Startup, Design Thinking, User-Centered Design, etc.)
* Iterative and incremental work methodologies (e.g. Agile, Kanban, Scrum, etc.)
* Data and reporting technical capabilities (e.g. SQL, Tableau, Looker, statistical methods, etc.)

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.  

Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here. *We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.*

title: (REMOTE) HR Rep I, HR Service Center Onboarding (Contingent)
description:
**Employment Type:**
Part time**Shift:**
Day Shift**Description:**
POSITION PURPOSE  

  

Provides assistance to managers, colleagues and vendors in the analysis and resolution of issues related to the service and delivery of talent management administration. Provides administrative support for Workday and Kronos to facilitate payroll processing. Provides support in the interpretation and application of policies and procedures for managers and colleagues, and acts to minimize company risk in all situations. Uses efficient and effective processes to support customers within the parameters of the department service level agreements. Markets department services and provides world class customer service.
\\*\\* Position allows for work remote/work from home opportunity.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Knows, understands, incorporates, and demonstrates the Trinity Health Mission, Vision, and Values in behaviors, practices, and decisions.


Provides Human Resource service delivery for the HR Service Center in areas relating to talent management administration. Responsible for the new hire registration process and change job administration for employment processes initiated by Talent Acquisition. This incorporates employment status changes that occur throughout a colleague's employment life cycle and includes integration for payroll processing systems.


Completes transactions for both new hire and change job administration for all processes initiated by Talent Acquisition. Partners with internal functional area teams to resolve issues and minimize exposure and risk.


Audits HRIS transactions daily, reviews and reconciles discrepancies with colleagues. Runs bi-weekly and monthly audit reports to ensure compliance and data integrity.


Relies on basic knowledge of Human Resource employment law, federal USCIS I-9 regulations and applicable payroll regulations related to onboarding new hires, re-hires and transfers.


Utilizes the case management technology to accurately track and log issues and notes for cases assigned under stringent Legal Department requirements.


Maintains confidentiality of department and associate information according to established practice within HIPAA and NPPI guidelines.


Maintains a working knowledge of applicable Federal, State, and local laws and regulations, Trinity Health’s Organizational Integrity Program, Standards of Conduct, as well as other policies and procedures in order to ensure adherence in a manner that reflects honest, ethical, and professional behavior.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Must possess a comprehensive understanding of Human Resources, Benefits, Payroll, Annual Enrollment, Leave Administration, HRIS, process integration and Contact/Service Center operations. A High School diploma with two (2) years of experience in an HR administrative or customer support role in a high volume work environment or an equivalent combination of education and experience.


Experience in Talent Acquisition, Recruitment and/or Onboarding processes preferred.


Familiarity with PeopleSoft, Workday and Kronos time and attendance systems is preferred.


Demonstrated decision making skills. Good communication skills, including good listening and comprehension skills, and human relations and interpersonal skills. Good analytic, problem solving, judgment and conflict resolution skills.


Ability to work independently with little supervision while organizing and prioritizing workload. Ability to handle multiple tasks, meet established deadlines and, with composure, work in a face paced work environment.


Ability to effectively interact and successfully represent the Department with managers, other various departments, functional areas and RHM's.


Demonstrated proficiency in MS Office Suite.


Must be comfortable operating in a collaborative, shared leadership environment.


Must possess a personal presence that is characterized by a sense of honesty, integrity, and caring with the ability to inspire and motivate others to promote the philosophy, mission, vision, goals, and values of Trinity Health.


PHYSICAL AND MENTAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORKING CONDITIONS
Must be able to set and organize own work priorities and adapt to them as they change frequently. Must be able to work concurrently on a variety of tasks/projects in an environment that may be stressful with individuals having diverse personalities and work styles.


Must be able to travel to the various Trinity Health sites (10%) as needed.


Must possess the ability to comply with Trinity Health policies and procedures.


Communicates frequently, in person and over the phone, with people in all locations on product support issues. Hearing is needed for extensive telephone and in person communication.


Operates in a typical office environment. The area is well lit, temperature controlled and free from hazards. There are no confined spaces.


Manual dexterity for keyboard use is necessary as well as the ability to work ergonomically in an office environment.

**Hourly pay ranges: $18.46 - $27.70**

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**

  

Trinity Health is one of the largest not-for-profit, Catholic healthcare systems in the nation. Built on the foundation of our Mission and Core Values, we integrate diversity, equity, and inclusion in all that we do. Our colleagues have different lived experiences, customs, abilities, and talents. Together, we become our best selves. A diverse and inclusive workforce provides the most accessible and equitable care for those we serve. Trinity Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other status protected by law.

title: Product Adoption / Onboarding Specialist
description:
**Reports: Head of Partner Onboarding/Training**


We are searching for a Product Adoption/Onboarding Specialist who is proactive and passionate about company products and helping set up our partners/customers for immediate success. Be a part of getting kids on the field by owning and managing positive relationships with partners/customers from the point of sale through successful implementation.


As a Product Adoption/Onboarding Specialist, you will educate new partners and ensure that all key stakeholders reach the necessary level of proficiency with Sports Connect. Be a liaison between partners and cross-functional internal teams to ensure the timely and successful delivery of our product solutions according to our initiatives and the partner's needs.


You can quickly pick up new technology and explain it to users with varying technical skills.


Throughout our partner’s journey, we pride ourselves on providing outstanding partner experiences and onboarding is the first step of that process.


This role sits on the Partner Experience team and reports to the Head of Partner Onboarding and Training.

**What you’ll be doing:**

**Initiate Partner Success Plan**


Once a sales representative has successfully acquired a new partner for Sports Connect, the Adoption/Onboarding Specialist is responsible for acting as the primary point of contact for that partner during the initial setup. It’s important that the Adoption/Onboarding Specialist initiates the onboarding process as quickly as possible to meet the agreed-upon timelines.

*Assess Needs*  

The Adoption/Onboarding Specialist will connect with the organization to get a detailed picture of its goals, requirements, and needs. New partner organizations may be unique in how they operate. For this reason, it’s crucial that the Adoption/Onboarding Specialist identify the unique priorities of each partner so they can plan accordingly.

*Customize the Plan*  

After identifying a partner’s main goals, the Adoption/Onboarding Specialist will need to use that information to customize the onboarding plan to ensure successful product adoption. This typically involves working backward from the projected launch date and ensuring all necessary training calls are scheduled. The Adoption/Onboarding Specialist will also be able to use the information gathered to know where to address the unique needs of the organization. Also, serves as a liaison between the partner and our web design specialist to ensure that expectations are set properly around custom web design options and processes and that proper delivery timelines are given.


Once onboarding is complete, the Adoption/Onboarding Specialist will successfully transfer the relationship to a Partner Success Manager or our Support Team.

**Demonstrate and Train**


The Adoption/Onboarding Specialist performs weekly and monthly virtual training webinars for Sports Connect partners to ensure a comfortable, working knowledge of the Sports Connect product. The Adoption/Onboarding Specialist will help create training tutorials and best practices to ensure that our new partners launch with confidence. Ensures that new league partners hit milestones of launch plans and that their initial experience with our company and software is both a positive and lasting one.

**Product Adoption/Retention**


The Training and Education team is responsible for ensuring our partners successfully adopt our products and quickly find value. With that, this team is engaged with developing new strategies and programs including but not limited to digital product adoption (in-app), in-person training, and developing educational content. The Adoption/Onboarding Specialist might be asked to assist in these areas as needed. Additionally, you may be asked to assist with support tickets to maintain product knowledge and as needed during our busy season.

**Other duties as assigned**

**Skills**

* 1-3 years of experience in support, partner experience, onboarding, training, product adoption, or similar (SaaS experience a plus)
* Excellent listening, verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
* Strong presentation skills (both live and pre-recorded)
* Experience hosting and/or moderating live training webinars
* Customer-service oriented
* Strong interpersonal and partner consultation skills
* Self-motivated and results-oriented
* Problem-solving & troubleshooting capabilities
* Ability to drive projects and manage project teams
* Ability to work effectively in a team environment
* Strong detail orientation
* Superior organizational abilities
* Process & procedure oriented
* Build relationships internal and external
* Ability to prioritize among competing tasks
* Ability to grasp partner’s needs and suggest timely solutions

**Here’s who we are looking for:**

* Love for Sports
* You’re passionate about teaching others
* You have a positive attitude and are eager to learn
* You are great at following instructions, yet flexible enough to roll up your sleeves and pitch in where needed
* You are outgoing, sociable, competitive, bright, and have integrity
* You are confident and have a proven track record of seeing projects through to completion
* You are a naturally motivated problem solver
* You are a great communicator and enjoy ongoing personal relationship-building
* You are always looking for new ways to sharpen your game and improve your performance
* You can adapt easily to a diverse group of partners
* You enjoy turning a challenge into an opportunity

**Nice to Haves:**

* Knowledge of the participatory sports market is an asset
* Experience with the Sports Connect product or similar sports management tools
* Experience with Product Adoption concepts and software. We currently use Intercom and Pendo

**What We Offer**

* Modern and collaborative work environment
* Supportive team members
* Entrepreneurial environment - leave your mark
* Comprehensive benefits package
* Fully paid parental leave

**We encourage all qualified candidates to apply**


We understand that no candidate is perfectly qualified for any job. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable, and passion and a positive attitude go a long way. Even more important than your résumé is a clear demonstration of dedication, impact, and the ability to thrive in a fluid and collaborative environment. We also know that diversity of background and thought makes for better problem-solving and more creative thinking, which is why we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.


If your experience is close to what we’re looking for, we’d love to hear from you.

*At this time, Stack Sports will not sponsor a Visa for this role. Stack Sports is an equal opportunity employer.*

title: Healthcare (Payer) Talent Acquisition Specialist
description:
**Company Description:**


Clearlink Partners is an industry-leading managed care consultancy specializing in end-to-end clinical and operational management services and market expansion initiatives for Managed Medicaid, Medicare Advantage, Special Needs Plans, complex care populations, and risk-adjusted entities.  

  

We support organizations as they navigate a dynamic healthcare ecosystem by helping them manage risk, optimize healthcare spend, improve member experience, accelerate quality outcomes, and promote health equity.
**Position Responsibilities:**

* Drive full cycle recruiting across all areas of the organization
* Responsible for management and oversight of the applicant tracking system. Maintain all pertinent applicant and interview data in system
* Schedule interviews between candidate and hiring managers
* Complete initial interview of candidates and only sending qualified candidates to hiring manager for consideration
	+ Assess applicants’ relevant knowledge, skills, soft skills, experience and aptitudes against position requirements
* Work with hiring managers to determine requirements for open positions
* Act as a point of contact and build influential candidate relationships during the selection process
* Initiate designated on-boarding steps (e.g. obtain copy of resume, completion of job application)
* Verify candidate credentials (i.e., RN license)
* Ensure that new staff is adhering to the requirements of applying for additional licensure(s) needed
* Establish Company brand in sourcing and recruiting activities and build networks to find qualified passive candidates
* Create and maintain online job postings across partnership network (Indeed, LinkedIn, Facebook).
* Source and recruit candidates using various sources such as databases, online job boards, career fairs and other networking events, social media networks, college job boards and employee referrals
* Develop a pool of qualified candidates in advance of need
* Research and recommend new sources for active and passive candidate recruiting
* Implement the Company’s recruiting strategy and build relationships with internal stakeholders, external community partners and organizations to support this strategy
* Collaborate with department managers on a regular basis to engage in workforce planning discussions; identifying future hiring needs and assessing current team structure
* Complete weekly reporting of activities to senior leadership as needed. Gather and analyze data with useful HR metrics


**Position Qualifications:**


* Competencies:
	+ Excellent organizational skills
	+ Excellent verbal and written communications skills
	+ Able to work independently as well as part of a team
	+ Able to act quickly when needed
	+ Able to accept instruction in a variety of ways including written and verbally
	+ Knowledge of applicant tracking system (Bullhorn experience is a plus)
	+ Proficient in MS Office Suite

* Experience:
	+ B.A. from a four-year college or university
	+ 3+ years of full-cycle recruiting experience within healthcare consulting
* Time Zone: Eastern or Central


  

**Other Information:**
* Expected Hours of Work: Monday – Friday; 8am – 5 pm;
* Travel: May be required, as needed by Client
* Direct Reports: None
* Salary Range: $75,000- $100,000


**EEO Statement:**


It is Clearlink Partners’ policy to provide equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants without regard to race, sex, sexual orientation, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status, parental status, family medical history or genetic information, political affiliation, military service or any other non-merit-based factor in accordance with all applicable laws, directives and regulations of Federal, state and city entities. This salary range reflects the minimum and maximum target wage for new hires of this position across all US locations. Individual pay will be influenced by Experience, Education, Specialized Soft Skills, and/or Geographic location.

title: Associate Specialist, Talent Acquisition (Texas) - Texas/REMOTE
description:

We are looking for a skilled Associate Specialist, Talent Acquisition, to be the liaison between NAM sites and agency. This person will be responsible for communicating needs to the agency and ordering temporary support for APLL on a timely manner and undertake a variety of day-to-day office and clerical tasks. You will be an integral part in ensuring that our operations run smoothly.

title: Client Onboarding Specialist
description:
**Company:** Jitasa

**Job Title:** Onboarding Specialist

**Location:** Boise, ID

**Employment Status:** Full Time

**Onboarding Specialist**

**About Us**

Jitasa is the first and largest international accounting and bookkeeping services provider dedicated solely to the nonprofit sector. Our name, Jitasa (ji-tah-suh), means “The Spirit of Serving Others.” It’s who we are and why we love playing a small role in the great work of our clients. We're accountants with two passions, numbers and helping the non-profit community.

**Why Join Our Team?**

We know that you have many employment opportunities, however few can match the unique and rewarding career that Jitasa offers. Join our team and we are committed to providing you the following:

**Clear Career Development & Opportunity** – We love to promote from within.

**Culture, Comradery, & Community** – We believe that work can and should be fun. We also share the same passion to help nonprofits do what they do best and that is what unites us.

**Mission-Driven Values, Meaningful Work** – We truly believe in our core values – Conscientious, Gracious, and Discipline – and they are what guide us as a company.

**Work/Life Harmony** – We are proud to offer flexible work schedules when needed.

**Global Team Experience** – We work closely with our international team members who all share our same passion for helping nonprofits.

**Job Description**

We're now hiring an Onboarding Specialist to help support our growing team. The primary role of this position is to lead and direct the onboarding of new clients into the Jitasa delivery system. The responsibilities of this role include:

Effectively communicate onboarding expectations and timelines with clients and co-workers

Implement best practice policies, procedures, and processes to be executed by the delivery teams

Configure internal and external systems as necessary

Support and train new clients on the adoption of Jitasa systems and processes

Analyze and architect the accounting structure of new clients to conform to the unified chart of accounts

Ensure all new clients are seamlessly transitioned to the delivery teams

Above all, provide a superior client experience to new organizations that join Jitasa!

If you're hard-working, have a proven ability to work independently, and passionate about serving non-profits, Jitasa is a perfect match that offers a career with both purpose and opportunity.

**Skills / Qualifications**

1. **Education:** A Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance is required.

2. **Work Experience:** Typically 2-3 years of relevant, hands-on accounting experience.

Candidates should have experience:

Managing multiple projects with competing priorities and deadlines

Setting clear expectations and timelines

Navigating and understanding ambiguous situations

Adapting to multiple scenarios

Independently solving complex situations

Directing and delegating tasks to others

**3. Skills:**

Candidates must possess a high level of general accounting knowledge and bookkeeping skills

Candidates must possess a high level of knowledge of NFP accounting principles

Candidates must possess excellent client communication skills and the ability to maintain a positive client relationship

Candidates must possess excellent communication skills internally with team members and demonstrate the ability to explain

complex things simply

Candidates must have a high proficiency in client management as well as project management. They must demonstrate the ability to manage multiple clients and projects to successful completion on time

Candidates must demonstrate good leadership skills and the ability to achieve results

Candidates must possess proficient conflict resolution skills

Candidates should be willing to collaborate and work effectively with others, both internally and externally in order to achieve goals.

Candidates should show initiative and follow through; and demonstrate that they’re highly motivated, a self-learner, and able to work independently

**4. Technical Competencies:**

Highly Skilled in Microsoft Excel

Highly Skilled in Mavenlink

Highly Skilled at email management via Microsoft Outlook

* Highly Skilled at learning and supporting new technologies and systems
* Highly Skilled at time management and coordinating schedules

**Compensation and Benefits**

**1. Compensation**

$65,000 - $75,000 base salary DOE

Quarterly bonus of up to $12,000 based on team and company performance

**2. Benefits & Perks**

Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance

Paid Sabbatical after 5 years of service

Generous Paid Time Off policy based on years of tenure

40 hours of Paid VTO (Volunteer Time Off) per year

401k plan with employer contribution match

Casual dress code and a fun and relaxed office culture

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Accounting: 1 year (Required)
* Client Onboarding: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Sourcing Recruiter - Healthcare (Contract)
description:
At **Carta Healthcare**, we believe in a multidisciplinary approach to solving problems. Our mission is to automate and simplify the work that burns out clinical staff, so they can focus on patient care. Our AI Enabled Technology offers a complete solution (people, process and technology) to support the Healthcare Registry Data Market. We design products that transform the way hospitals use data to deliver care. We make analyzing data fast, easy, and useful for everyone. We give clinicians time back to focus on research and care that improve patient lives by reducing paperwork. Carta Healthcare is a remote organization with headquarters in San Francisco and Portland, Oregon.


To learn more about our AI Enabled Solutions and more about our company, please *visit www.carta.healthcare*


Joining Carta Healthcare as a Sourcing Recruiter means stepping into a pivotal role where you'll be instrumental in identifying, engaging, and attracting top-tier talent to fuel the growth of our organization. Working closely with the Talent Acquisition Manager, you'll be tasked with sourcing and maintaining a steady stream of qualified candidates across various healthcare roles. Your success in this position hinges on your exceptional sourcing abilities, proven track record of locating passive candidates, and a deep understanding of the healthcare sector.


***This will initially be a 1099 contract position with the opportunity to convert to full time.***


**Responsibilities:**


* Proactively sourcing and engaging potential candidates through diverse channels like direct outreach, networking, and referrals.
* Focusing 80% of your time on sourcing passive talent with nursing or quality experience within health systems.
* Managing candidate pipelines and nurturing relationships with passive candidates for future opportunities.
* Providing regular updates on sourcing progress, candidate pipeline status, and market insights to relevant stakeholders.
* Monitoring key metrics related to sourcing activities such as candidate outreach, response rates, and conversion rates.
* Analyzing sourcing data to pinpoint areas for enhancement and fine-tune sourcing strategies for maximum efficiency and impact.
* Tracking all key metrics that demonstrate the effectiveness of the sourcing recruiting strategy and adjusting direction as needed.

  


**What You'll Need:**


* 2+ years of experience in sourcing and recruiting Nurses or Physicians.
* Proficiency in advanced sourcing techniques like Boolean search and data mining.
* Experience with Greenhouse is highly preferred.
* Proficiency in LinkedIn Recruiter is essential, with bonus points for familiarity with other outbound sourcing tools like SeekOut, Hire Ez, and Contact Out.
* Demonstrated success in delivering qualified sourced candidates within a metrics-driven environment.
* Strong organizational skills with meticulous attention to detail and accuracy.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, coupled with high standards of professional behavior and ethics.
* Flexibility to thrive in a demanding, fast-paced, and dynamically changing environment.


All applicants require legal authorization to work in the United States now or in the future without sponsorship.

*In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire. All applicants are required to reside within the continental United States.*


*Carta Healthcare is dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive company because we serve health systems across the country; we've seen how our product and impact are strengthened the more we reflect that diversity. In addition, we have found and strongly believe that diverse teams are higher-performing, and we embrace the varied perspectives that our team members share with each other. As such, we are an Equal Opportunity Employer.*



#LI-Remote #BI-Remote

title: Corporate Recruiter - Federal Government Contracting
description:
**Corporate Profile:**  

Acquisition Professionals (AP) LLC is a trusted strategic partner and solutions-based company that combines years of deep knowledge-based expertise, agile program management, and customized learning solutions, AP provides cradle-to-grave acquisition services and acquisition training; administrative support services; Information Technology Support Services and program and financial management. We leverage technology, tools, and industry best practices through our experienced personnel to create cross-functional results and navigate the complex and high-risk areas for our clients' projects and programs.
  
  

**Job Summary:**  

Acquisition Professionals LLC is seeking a full-time Corporate Recruiter with Federal Government Contracting experience; responsible for finding, recruiting, hiring, and retaining talented candidates. The Corporate Recruiter will be in charge of planning, developing, and implementing an effective Talent Acquisition strategy for the organization. This is a remote position; DC Metro area residents preferred, but not required.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* The recruiting process may involve both internal and external sourcing methods, thereby requiring the individual to be adept at understanding where and how to locate candidates.
* The position entails the candidate utilizing both traditional and non-traditional resources and having a network of established contacts to identify and attract talent.
* Individual will be responsible for attracting suitable candidates for open job positions and assessing their relevant knowledge and experience, identifying future hiring needs, designing job descriptions, sourcing candidates through databases and social media, conducting interviews, and keeping abreast of employment law and legislation.
* Resources often include community networking events, job fairs, online sources, career fairs, and advertising/marketing programs.
* Remains up to date on the requirements of the various positions in the company, and acts as an advocate for new and established employees.
* Collaborating with department managers to compile a consistent list of requirements to design and implement an overall recruiting strategy.
* Conducting regular follow-up with managers to determine the effectiveness of recruiting plans and implementation.
* Conducting interviews and sorting through applicants to fill open positions while growing a strong talent pipeline.
* Promoting the company's reputation as “best place to work” and attractiveness as a good employment opportunity.
* Providing analytical and well documented recruiting reports to team managers and company executives by developing and tracking goals for the recruiting and hiring process (i.e., data on cost per hire and time-to-hire).
* Update job descriptions and job specifications and develop a pool of qualified candidates in advance of need.
* Perform intake sessions to determine job requirements.
* Research and recommend new sources for active and passive candidate recruiting.
* Prepare recruitment materials and post jobs to appropriate job boards, association memberships, trade groups, and social media, etc.
* Monitor and apply HR recruiting best practices.
* Act as a point of contact and build influential candidate relationships during the selection process. Following up on the interview process status.
* Communicating employer information and benefits during screening process and managing the job offer including negotiation.
* Responsible for screening resumes to determine which candidates meet the core competencies and then move chosen candidates to the next step in the hiring process.
* Responsible for conducting initial candidate screenings in order to narrow the number of potential candidates to be interviewed by the hiring manager.
* Responsible for scheduling interviews between the chosen candidates and the Hiring Manager.


**Education/Certifications:**  

* Bachelor's degree in human resources, Business Management, or Business Administration, with proven work experience in screening, interviewing, and assessing candidates


**Required Qualifications:**  

Must have a minimum of 5 years of experience recruiting for companies supporting Government contracts.
  
  

* Must have experience with recruitment processes and databases.
* Must possess the ability to design and implement recruiting strategies.
* Must possess excellent communication skills including the ability to listen proactively, ask the right questions and clarify the needs of the client and candidate.
* Must have strong decision-making and interpersonal skills.
* Must be organized and detail oriented.
* Must have solid ability to conduct different types of interviews (structured, competency-based, stress etc.)
* Must have adaptability, to include the ability to work effectively with diverse people.
* Must have the flexibility to adapt to changing priorities.
* Must be a team player.
* Must be adept at negotiating, problem analysis and problem solving.
* Must have hands-on experience with various selection processes (phone interviewing, reference check etc.).
* Must be Proactive, Pre-emptive, Engaged and Hands-on.
* Must be able to assess candidates' skills, experience and relevant knowledge and compare them to job requirements.
* Must have discretion due to dealing with confidential information.
* Must be a United States Citizen.


**Corporate Summary:**  

Acquisition Professionals (AP) LLC is an Economically Disadvantaged, Woman-Owned, 8 (a) small business. We are located at Quantico Corporate Center in Stafford, Virginia. We offer a competitive salary and compensation benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, disability, matching 401k, tax free transit subsidy, paid federal government holidays and paid time off. AP is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and are committed to creating an all-inclusive environment for all employees. We do not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind.

title: Remote Recruiter
description:
**Job Summary:**
 Saunders Staffing Agency is seeking motivated individuals to join our team as Remote Recruiters on a commission-only basis. No prior experience is required. As a Remote Recruiter with Saunders Staffing Agency, you will be responsible for sourcing, screening, and selecting qualified candidates for various job openings across different industries. This is a remote position, allowing you the flexibility to work from anywhere with a reliable computer and internet connection. Leads are provided, but you can also source your own candidates to maximize your earning potential. You will receive support from upper management to assist you in achieving your recruitment goals. **Responsibilities:*** Source potential candidates using various online platforms, networking, referrals, and provided leads.
* Review and analyze resumes to determine suitability and fit for specific job roles.
* Conduct initial phone screenings to assess candidate qualifications, skills, and experience.
* Coordinate and schedule interviews between candidates and hiring managers.
* Provide guidance and support to candidates throughout the recruitment process.
* Negotiate offers and terms of employment with selected candidates.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate records in the applicant tracking system.
* Collaborate with team members to meet recruitment goals and targets.
* Stay informed about industry trends, market conditions, and best practices in recruitment.
* Represent Saunders Staffing Agency professionally and positively in all interactions with candidates and clients.

 **Requirements:*** Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to learn and adapt quickly in a fast-paced environment.
* Solid understanding of basic computer skills and internet usage.
* High level of motivation and self-discipline.
* Comfortable working independently and managing time effectively in a remote setting.
* Willingness to follow established recruitment processes and guidelines.

 **Benefits:*** Flexibility to work remotely from anywhere.
* Unlimited earning potential based on a commission structure.
* Opportunity to gain valuable experience and skills in recruitment.
* Access to training and development resources to enhance recruiting abilities.
* Support from upper management to assist in achieving recruitment goals.

 **Compensation:*** Commission-based compensation structure.
* Earn anywhere from $1000 to $5000 per candidate submitted, based on successful placements.

 **Note: This is a commission-only position with no guaranteed salary or benefits. A reliable computer and internet connection are required for this role. Leads are provided, but you can also source your own candidates to maximize earning potential.**

title: Talent Acquisition Director
description:
**Talent Acquisition Director (Fully Remote, US Time Zones)**


As the first full time recruiting hire at TLDR, you will be at the forefront of managing our full-cycle recruiting pipeline. You will be responsible for resume screening, interviewing, salary negotiation and moving candidates through our pipeline until onboarding.

**Who We Are**


TLDR is a collective of technical newsletters on startups, software engineering, AI, cybersecurity, marketing, product management, and more, with over 5 million subscribers.


Our mission is to build the paper of record for technical fields, the trusted source that people who work in tech rely on to inform them about important trends and developments.

**Qualifications**

* 5+ years of experience in sales recruiting (preferably directly recruiting for BDRs and AEs)
* Preferably experience in media sales recruiting
* Exceptional ability to communicate our company goals and vision to candidates and get them excited about the opportunity
* Detail oriented and able to use metrics to identify issues with and improve our processes
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to operate in a highly ambiguous, fast-paced collaborative environment

**Responsibilities**

* Build a strong hiring pipeline through sourcing or recruiting channels
* Move a high volume of candidates through our recruiting pipeline in an organized fashion
* Develop and maintain all recruiting metrics to determine the effectiveness of our hiring strategies and the quality of our hires
* Continually be looking for ways to identify issues and improve our processes

**Compensation**  

The base salary range for this role is $80,000 - $90,000 plus a performance based bonus.

**Benefits**


401(k) plan, medical, dental and vision benefits, maternity/paternity leave, hardware stipend, education stipend, unlimited PTO.

title: Sr. Recruiting Coordinator (Part-Time Contract)
description:
At Apartment List, we're on a mission to find every renter a home they love at the value they deserve. Finding the right place to live is one of the most important, time-consuming and expensive decisions that all of us make. Getting it right matters. We've helped millions of families find a home they love, and we're just getting started.


We're looking for a motivated, detail-oriented, part-time Sr. Recruiting Coordinator to help us scale our growing teams! Like us, you understand that extraordinary Talent team members are brand advocates, strategic partners, and curators of strong talent pipelines. In this role, you'll be responsible for supporting our team of recruiters, building relationships with hiring teams, and acting as the guardian of the candidate experience.



\\*\\*\\* This position is remote within the US. This position is a short-term (~2 months) and part-time (~20 hours per week) contract. The hourly pay rate is between $40/hr - $60/hr.


**Here's what you'll do as part of the team:**


* Support the recruitment process by scheduling all levels of interviews, both virtual and on-site
* Provide personal, tailored outbound communication to prospects and candidates
* Collaborate with the Talent team and Hiring Managers to understand the interview process for each role
* Design and own recruiting projects and initiatives to improve current processes; an exceptional candidate experience is top priority
* Communicate with candidates regularly to ensure they have accurate interview information and preparation for their interviews
* Maintain our applicant tracking system, job postings, interview guides, and offer presentations to ensure complete accuracy
* Maintain a high level of confidentiality
* Represent the company with integrity and professionalism


**Here are the skills you'll need to be successful:**

  

* 2 - 3 years of recruiting coordination experience, ideally for a high-growth, consumer-facing tech company
* Proven track record of successfully supporting the recruiting team and hiring teams, while prioritizing an exceptional candidate experience
* Experience coordinating for a variety of roles (i.e. sales, marketing, engineering, product, finance, etc.)
* Strong interpersonal and consultative skills
* Able to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively
* Proven ability to thrive in fast-paced, entrepreneurial environments
* Detail-oriented and well-organized
* Personable with a great work ethic and positive attitude
* Hands-on experience with Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS), ideally Greenhouse
* BA/BS degree preferred

**Here's what's in it for you (full-time employees only; does not apply to contract roles):**


* Competitive Compensation: Including annual salary, pre-IPO stock options, and other financial compensation (if applicable)
* Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage: 100% of premiums covered for you AND all of your dependents
* Unlimited Flexible Time Off: Unlimited FTO in addition to 12 company holidays per year, quarterly "recharge" days, and a week-long holiday break
* Home Office Reimbursement: To cover home office furniture and supplies, monthly home internet, and monthly cell phone (if applicable)
* Health & Wellness Reimbursement: To cover monthly gym membership or other qualifying expenses
* Parental Support: Generous parental and family leave, fertility benefits, and employer-sponsored stipends towards family forming services
* 401k Plan: To support you in your individual retirement goals
* Team Events: Frequent team-building events, fun team off-sites, and bi-annual company meetups
* Commitment to DEI: To prioritize Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion within our workplace and to stay true to our values and mission
* Mentorship and Training: To get you onboard quickly, learn new professional skills, and invest in your career development
* Impact and Visibility: To expose you to and provide the opportunity to work on highly strategic initiatives that will transform the business
* Encouragement and Empowerment: To explore and adopt new technologies and drive meaningful decisions and outcomes


At Apartment List we believe that everyone deserves a home they love AND a career they love. We strive to build a diverse team that is a reflection of the people we serve; this is made possible through our commitment to fostering a culture of diversity, inclusion, equity, and connectedness.



As a proud equal opportunity employer, we celebrate the collection of individual differences, life experiences, ideas, perspectives, knowledge, and talent. We hire candidates of any race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital or family status, disability, Veteran status, and any other status.

title: National Director, Talent Acquisition - Remote (onsite-if desired)
description:
Description:

If you excel at providing consultative services, have a passion for our mission, and strive to ensure the delivery of high quality, efficient, cost-effective, and responsive services to all internal and external stakeholders, we invite you to consider joining the Devereux Advanced Behavioral Health team; become part of, and support Devereux’s outstanding nationwide team of people operations (human resources) leadership!  

Devereux Advanced Behavioral Health is one of the nation’s largest nonprofit organizations providing services, insight and leadership in the evolving field of behavioral healthcare.

  

Founded in 1912 by special education pioneer Helena Devereux, Devereux operates a comprehensive network of clinical, therapeutic, educational and employment programs and services that positively impact the lives of tens of thousands of children, adults – and their families – every year. The organization’s unique approach combines evidence-based interventions with compassionate family engagement.

  

With nearly 6,500 employees working in programs across the U.S., Devereux is a trusted partner for families, schools and communities, serving many of our country’s most vulnerable populations in the areas of autism, intellectual and developmental disabilities, specialty mental health, education and foster care.

  

Working collaboratively with the Senior Vice President of People Operations, the **National Director, Talent Acquisition,** will  

* Responsible for the development and implantation of the overall organizational Talent Acquisition Strategy
* Develops and continually evolves best practices in the sourcing, recruitment and selection of high quality employees in support of the Devereux mission
* Oversee and manage a national recruitment budget
* Owner of overall national sourcing plan partners/tools
* Skill with effective contract negotiation/management (iCIMS, job boards, social media advertising/strategy etc.)
* Provides expert consultation to local recruitment teams to increase effectiveness and recruitment results
* As the national recruitment Lead, train & guide 30+ recruiters/teams across the organization
* Directly manages the National Specialty Recruitment Team (4 direct reports)
* Ensures a metric driven approach to assess and evaluate talent acquisition performance
* Stay current with recruitment and industry trends, and emerging recruitment techniques and tools

**Interested in advancing your career?** Devereux is proud to offer ASCEND – the first career accelerator program exclusively designed to give behavioral healthcare workers – the career guidance, one-on-one coaching, skills and financial assistance you need to reach your full potential. This program includes 100% of tuition covered (up to $15k reimbursed annually for undergraduate and $25k reimbursed annually for graduate) and student loan repayment! Learn more here.
Qualifications:  

* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Management, Business Administration or related field. Master’s degree and/or Human Resources/Recruitment certification preferred.
* Minimum of six (6) years of full cycle, high-volume recruitment.
* Experience in a multi-site organization, with a minimum of two (2) years of experience leading/managing a recruitment function.
* Experience working in a behavioral healthcare/healthcare environment is preferred.
* Change management skills required with the demonstrated ability to translate strategic recruitment goals into action through influence and collaboration.
* Requires excellent customer service skills
* Experience working in iCIMS a plus

  

Devereux has a zero-tolerance policy for abuse and maintains policies and procedures to systematically reduce the risk of abuse to occur in our organization. Devereux fosters a culture of reporting abuse, and will cooperate with the authorities to the fullest extent possible.

title: Technical Recruiter - Part time
description:

title: Talent Acquisition Partner
description:
Talent Acquisition Director

About Us:

At Ease Healthcare Inc., is an investment group specializing in healthcare investments. We specialize in business transactions and M&A. We focus on a few niches, like home healthcare, skilled nursing and hospice - however we have the expertise and resources to perform in adjacent industries if their is an opportunity. We involve ourselves in a wide range of dynamic fast paced transactions ranging from 50 Thousand to 25 Million. Current teams include a Board of directors, Advisory board, virtual back office, and sales team - with a staff, in transition, of over 20 employees. The holding company is operated by the board which has over 250 years of cumulative experience with over $20 Billion in completed transactions - experience as Directors of Top 50 largest companies in the USA and current executives of publicly traded companies.

Position specific information:

As the Talent Acquisition Director, you will lead our aggressive recruitment efforts, oversee the end-to-end recruitment process, manage a team of recruiters, and play a crucial role in identifying and attracting high-potential candidates.

First task is/will be to successfully recruit a Home Healthcare Area Manager that is fluent in Filipino for the Beverly Hills and/or Torrance, CA areas, starting immediately.

Responsibilities & Expectations:

- Develop and implement effective talent acquisition strategies aligned with the company's goals and growth plans.

- Lead and manage a team of recruiters, providing guidance, support, and mentorship to ensure the team's success.

- Monitor and optimize the entire recruitment process, from sourcing and screening to interviewing and onboarding, ensuring efficiency and effectiveness.

- Collaborate with department heads and hiring managers to understand their talent needs and develop tailored recruitment plans.

- Utilize innovative sourcing techniques to identify and attract high-potential candidates, including passive candidates.

- Build and maintain a network of potential candidates through proactive outreach and relationship building.

- Ensure compliance with relevant employment laws and regulations throughout the recruitment process.

- Analyze recruitment metrics to measure the effectiveness of strategies and identify areas for improvement.

- Stay abreast of best of best practices in talent acquisition, implementing continuous improvements.

- High performance attitude, highly adaptable to the dynamic and fast paced nature of our projects.

Requirements:

- Proven track record in building high performance teams.

- Ability to start immediately and begin performing at a high level

- Subscriptions to best of best recruiting platforms and tools - i.e.

- Strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire and manage a team.

- Comprehensive knowledge of employer friendly recruiting laws, regulations and practices.

- Strong understanding of “Outcome Management” and it’s appropriate recruiting practices.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships at all levels.

- Proactive and strategic mindset, with the ability to anticipate talent needs and challenges.

- Tech-savvy, with proficiency in recruitment software and tools.

- Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.

- Previous experience in healthcare or a related industry is a plus.

Job Type:

- Full-time

Salary:

- Introductory probationary period

-Salary Competitive and commensurate with scope of project/Negotiable.

Benefits:

- Health insurance

- 401(k)

- Flexible schedule

Schedule:

- Monday to Friday

Application Question:

- In your application, please provide examples of successful recruitment strategies you've implemented in the past.

Experience:

- Talent Acquisition or Senior Recruitment: Preferred

- Self Motivated High-performance individual

Language:

- English (Required)

Work Location:

- Remote

Join At Ease Healthcare Inc. and take a leadership role in shaping our organization's talent landscape. If you are a strategic thinker, a motivator, and have a Proven track record in building high performance teams.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Temporary

Pay: $45,000.00 - $135,000.00 per year

Expected hours: 3 – 80 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible schedule

* Relocation assistance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

title: Client Onboarding Specialist (REMOTE OPPORTUNITY)
description:
**Job Title:** CLIENT ONBOARDING SPECIALIST
  
  

**Department:** DCM Reporting - Palmer location
  
  

**Reports to:** DCM Reporting
  
  

**FLSA Status:** Non-Exempt
  
  

**Company Information:**  

DISA Global Solutions is an industry-leading safety and compliance solutions provider with customers across the Globe since 1986 and more than 1,200+ Team members across more than 30 locations. When you join the DISA Team, you join an industry leader that more than 30% of fortune 500 companies use. With a rich history of IT innovation, we have more than 55,000 customers and complete more than 10 million orders each year.
  
  

DISA is proud to be a “Top Workplaces” award winner across multiple locations in 2023. We offer competitive pay, a robust benefits package, and an exciting place to work. We have a collaborative and team-oriented culture with numerous opportunities for career advancement. We host monthly appreciation events, and our internal learning and development team provides the resources for employees to engage in continuing education and training.
  
  

**Position Summary:** Entry Level position interacts with contractors and operators daily and provides excellent and prompt customer service by ensuring that contractors/subcontractors are meeting the regulatory guidelines requested by owner/operator. Will assist with billing in conjunction with the Department Manager and escalated issues as needed.
  
  

**Qualifications required:**  

* High school diploma and two (2) years of billing and or auditing experience
* Intermediate skill level Microsoft excel, and Microsoft outlook and PowerPoint.
* Excellent attention to detail
* Auditing company compliance documents
* Typing 50wpm with 99% accuracy or Data Entry 8,000 KPH with 99% accuracy.


**Qualifications desired:**  

* Experience in DOT compliance
* Experience in a busy office environment
* Understanding of DOT drug and alcohol regulations


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**  

* Answers incoming phone calls, emails and voice messages assisting clients
* Helping customers complete their account setup and implementation.
* Ensuring a smooth adoption of the product.
* Solving arising customer problems in a timely manner.
* Enhancing user engagement with educational materials and contextual onboarding flows.
* Leveraging feedback for continuous improvement of the onboarding process.
* Working with the customer success team to build strong relationships with existing users.
* Developing metrics to understand if the implementation is successful or not.
* Reviewing client application to determine which applicants meet the criteria for new clients.
* Turnaround times could range from 3 days to 14 days for onboarding.
* Assist Lead Compliance Coordinator with onboarding billing.
* Prepare and review excel spreadsheets for company status.
* Reviews and Audits (Department of Transportation) DOT and NON-DOT contractor/ and or subcontractor’s drug and alcohol data with review of DOT and NON-DOT plans for accuracy.
* Send detailed mass email reminders to contractors/subcontractors.
* Perform administrative and other tasks as needed yearly updates/ prepare for client audits and on-site audits for contractors and subcontractors.
* Provide reliable home internet and consistent professional work environment conducive to production, learning, and interaction with clients and colleagues.


**Physical Working Conditions (ADA):**  

The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  
  

**Physical demands:** While performing the duties of this job the employee is regularly required to talk, hear, walk, sit, stand, use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms.
  
  

WORK SCHEDULE - M - F- 8:30 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. EST
  
  

EOE/M/F/Vet/Disability
  
  

* Please Note: Your Actual Pay-Rate within the Pay Range will vary based on: Geography, Skill-Set and applicable Local and State Pay Practices. Any questions, please contact our DISA Recruiting Team at Recruitment.Recruitment@disa.com.

title: Recruiter - Intermediate level - Corporate
description:
**Recruiter (Intermediate)**  

**Remote**  

Grant Leading Technology (GLT) is seeking a candidate for a Recruiter to join our dynamic team. As a Recruiter, you will play a vital role in identifying and attracting top talent for GLT. You will be responsible for the end-to-end recruitment process, from sourcing and screening candidates to setting up interviews, to the offer letter stage. Your excellent communication skills, along with a deep understanding of the recruitment landscape, will contribute to the success of the company. This position will be remote, and the hours are 8 am to 5 pm EST.  

  

**Responsibilities:*** Utilize various sourcing methods to identify potential candidates
* Proactively build and maintain a network of qualified candidates for future job openings
* Conduct thorough candidate research and market analysis to stay up-to-date with industry trends and competitor activities
* Use the Applicant Tracking System to manage the end-to-end recruitment process, keep accurate and up-to-date candidate records, schedule interviews, etc.
* Review resumes to assess candidate qualifications and suitability for specific positions
* Conduct comprehensive phone and/or video interviews to evaluate candidates' skills, experience, and cultural fit
* Administer relevant assessments and tests to assess candidates' technical abilities and job-specific knowledge
* Work with hiring managers to ensure all steps are followed in a timely manner
* Stay organized and prioritize tasks effectively to meet individual recruitment targets
* Collaborate with the internal team to develop innovative recruitment strategies and improve overall recruitment effectiveness
* Work with the Recruiting and HR departments to ensure compliance with EOO data requirements and the Affirmative Action Plan
* Responsible for part in company’s overall retention plan
* Collect references from candidates at the panel interview stage
* Communicate with candidates throughout the process including informing them when they have been rejected
* Any additional administrative tasks for the Recruiting department including but not limited to, keeping meeting notes, teaching new managers how to use the applicant tracking system, etc.

  

**Qualifications and Education Requirements:**  

* Bachelor of Science (BS) degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field
* Five (5) to eight (8) years of proven experience as a Recruiter
* At least five (5) years’ experience as a corporate recruiter
* Experience recruiting passive candidates
* Deep knowledge of various recruitment techniques
* Knowledge of discrimination and employment laws
* Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS)
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build and maintain relationships with clients, candidates, and team members
* Exceptional time management and organizational skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritize effectively
* Strong attention to detail and the ability to maintain accuracy
* High level of professionalism and integrity, ensuring confidentiality and ethical recruitment practices
* Must live in the United States
* Must be authorized to work in the United States

**Preferred Skills:*** Experience using UKG (Kronos) Applicant Tracking System
* Experience working in a government contracting company or directly for a government agency
* Experience recruiting for diverse teams

  

**About Grant Leading Technology:**  

  

Grant Leading Technology (GLT) is a verified Service-Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) government contracting firm. GLT provides expert knowledge and skills to deliver agile enterprise solutions and innovative technologies to our clients at the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), Internal Revenue Service (IRS), Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA), National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA), and other federal and state agencies. We possess exceptional capabilities including, but not limited to, project management, cyber security, construction management, design, and management technology. GLT has been recognized for three consecutive years by Inc. 5000 as one of the fastest-growing private companies in America.  

  

Our employees are at the heart of GLT’s success. We value and fully embrace the diversity of individuals and ideas within our workforce. GLT provides a competitive compensation package with benefits that are immediately available. Our base healthcare plan is 100% employer paid and our 401k plan is immediately vested. We also offer paid time off, 11 federal holidays, short/long-term disability, 401k matching, and opportunities for professional development.  

www.grantleadingtechnology.com  

  

* *Grant Leading Technology is an “equal opportunity employer”. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Reasonable accommodations will be provided to those who are unable to utilize our online application system due to a disability. Please email* *recruiting@grantleadingtechnology.com* *with the subject line “Accommodation”*
